</div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_active_blog_for_user"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_active_blog_for_user" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_active_blog_for_user .collapse"> <h2>Get one of a user's active blogs</h2> <pre>get_active_blog_for_user(int $user_id) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Returns the user's primary blog, if she has one and it is active. If it's inactive, function returns another active blog of the user. If none are found, the user is added as a Subscriber to the Dashboard Blog and that blog is returned.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU 1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_blogs_of_user()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\add_user_to_blog()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_blog_details()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$user_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>The unique ID of the user</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>The blog object</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_adjacent_post"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_adjacent_post" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_adjacent_post .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve adjacent post.</h2> <pre>get_adjacent_post(bool $in_same_cat, array | string $excluded_categories, bool $previous) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Can either be next or previous post.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$in_same_cat</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Whether post should be in a same category.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$excluded_categories</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Optional. Array or comma-separated list of excluded category IDs.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$previous</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Whether to retrieve previous post.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Post object if successful. Null if global $post is not set. Empty string if no corresponding post exists.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_adjacent_post_rel_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_adjacent_post_rel_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_adjacent_post_rel_link .collapse"> <h2>Get adjacent post relational link.</h2> <pre>get_adjacent_post_rel_link(string $title, bool $in_same_cat, array | string $excluded_categories, bool $previous) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Can either be next or previous post relational link.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$title</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Link title format.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$in_same_cat</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Whether link should be in a same category.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$excluded_categories</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Optional. Array or comma-separated list of excluded category IDs.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$previous</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is true. Whether to display link to previous or next post.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_admin_page_parent"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_admin_page_parent" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_admin_page_parent .collapse"> <h2>get_admin_page_parent() </h2> <pre>get_admin_page_parent($parent) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$parent</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_admin_page_title"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_admin_page_title" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_admin_page_title .collapse"> <h2>get_admin_page_title() </h2> <pre>get_admin_page_title() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_admin_url"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_admin_url" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_admin_url .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the url to the admin area for a given site.</h2> <pre>get_admin_url(int $blog_id, string $path, string $scheme) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$blog_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>(optional) Blog ID. path of archive template in current or parent template.</h2> <pre>get_archive_template() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_archives"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_archives" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_archives .collapse"> <h2>get_archives() </h2> <pre>get_archives(string $type, string $limit, string $format, string $before, string $after, bool $show_post_count) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>2.1</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use wp_get_archives()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\wp_get_archives()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$type</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$limit</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$format</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$before</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$after</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$show_post_count</h4> <code>bool</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_archives_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_archives_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_archives_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve archive link content based on predefined or custom code.</h2> <pre>get_archives_link(string $url, string $text, string $format, string $before, string $after) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The format can be one of four styles. The 'link' for head element, 'option' for use in the select element, 'html' for use in list (either ol or ul HTML elements). Custom content is also supported using the before and after parameters.</p> <p>The 'link' format uses the link HTML element with the <em>archives</em> relationship. The before and after parameters are not used. The text parameter is used to describe the link.</p> <p>The 'option' format uses the option HTML element for use in select element. The value is the url parameter and the before and after parameters are used between the text description.</p> <p>The 'html' format, which is the default, uses the li HTML element for use in the list HTML elements. The before parameter is before the link and the after parameter is after the closing link.</p> <p>The custom format uses the before parameter before the link ('a' HTML element) and the after parameter after the closing link tag. If the above three values for the format are not used, then custom format is assumed.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$url</h4> <code>string</code><p>URL to archive.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$text</h4> <code>string</code><p>Archive text description.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$format</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is 'html'. Can be 'link', 'option', 'html', or custom.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$before</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$after</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>HTML link content for archive.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_attached_file"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_attached_file" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_attached_file .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve attached file path based on attachment ID.</h2> <pre>get_attached_file(int $attachment_id, bool $unfiltered) : string | bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>You can optionally send it through the 'get_attached_file' filter, but by default it will just return the file path unfiltered.</p> <p>The function works by getting the single post meta name, named '_wp_attached_file' and returning it. This is a convenience function to prevent looking up the meta name and provide a mechanism for sending the attached filename through a filter.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attachment_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Attachment ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$unfiltered</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to apply filters.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code>bool</code>The file path to the attached file, or false if the attachment does not exist.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_attachment_fields_to_edit"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_attachment_fields_to_edit" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_attachment_fields_to_edit .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>get_attachment_fields_to_edit(\unknown_type $post, \unknown_type $errors) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$errors</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_attachment_icon"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_attachment_icon" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_attachment_icon .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve HTML content of icon attachment image element.</h2> <pre>get_attachment_icon(int $id, bool $fullsize, array $max_dims) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use wp_get_attachment_image()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\wp_get_attachment_image()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Whether to have full size image.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$max_dims</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. Whether to have full image.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Icon URL and full path to file, respectively.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_attachment_innerHTML"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_attachment_innerHTML" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_attachment_innerHTML .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve HTML content of image element.</h2> <pre>get_attachment_innerHTML(int $id, bool $fullsize, array $max_dims) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use wp_get_attachment_image()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\wp_get_attachment_image()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$fullsize</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default to false. Whether to have full size image.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$max_dims</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. Dimensions of image.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_attachment_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_attachment_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_attachment_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve permalink for attachment.</h2> <pre>get_attachment_link(int $id) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This can be used in the WordPress Loop or outside of it.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. The second check is for the second part of the mime type. The last check is for both types separated by an underscore. If neither are found then the file 'attachment.php' is checked and returned.</p> <p>Some examples for the 'text/plain' mime type are 'text.php', 'plain.php', and finally 'text_plain.php'.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_author_feed_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_author_feed_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_author_feed_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the feed link for a given author.</h2> <pre>get_author_feed_link(int $author_id, string $feed) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Returns a link to the feed for all posts by a given author. This is useful to check whether you need to install an option and is commonly used during installation of plugin options and to test whether upgrading is required.</p> <p>There is a filter called 'blog_option_$option' with the $option being replaced with the option name. The filter takes two parameters. $value and $blog_id. It returns $value. The 'option_$option' filter in get_option() is not called.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$blog_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_blogaddress_by_name .collapse"> <h2>Get a full blog URL, given a blog name.</h2> <pre>get_blogaddress_by_name(string $blogname) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr></table> response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_bloginfo"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_bloginfo" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_bloginfo .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve information about the blog.</h2> <pre>get_bloginfo(string $show, string $filter) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Some show parameter values are deprecated and will be removed in future versions. These options will trigger the _deprecated_argument() function. The deprecated blog info options are listed in the function contents.</p> <p>The possible values for the 'show' parameter are listed below.</p> <ol> <li><strong>url</strong> - Blog URI to homepage.</li> <li><strong>wpurl</strong> - Blog URI path to WordPress.</li> <li><strong>description</strong> - Secondary title</li> </ol> <p>The feed URL options can be retrieved from 'rdf_url' (RSS 0.91), 'rss_url' (RSS 1.0), 'rss2_url' (RSS 2.0), or 'atom_url' (Atom feed). The comment feeds can be retrieved from the 'comments_atom_url' (Atom comment feed) or 'comments_rss2_url' (RSS 2.0 comment feed).</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$show</h4> <code>string</code><p>Blog info to retrieve.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filter</h4> <code>string</code><p>How to filter what is retrieved.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Mostly string values, might be empty.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_bloginfo_rss"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_bloginfo_rss" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_bloginfo_rss .collapse"> <h2>RSS container for the bloginfo function.</h2> <pre>get_bloginfo_rss(string $show) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>You can retrieve anything that you can using the get_bloginfo() function. Everything will be stripped of tags and characters converted, when the values are retrieved for use in the feeds.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Feed.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Feed</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.1</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_bloginfo()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$show</h4> <code>string</code><p>See get_bloginfo() for possible values.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_blogs_of_user"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_blogs_of_user" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_blogs_of_user .collapse"> <h2>Get the blogs a user belongs to.</h2> <pre>get_blogs_of_user(int $user_id, bool $all) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$user_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>User ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$all</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to retrieve all blogs, or only blogs that are not marked as deleted, archived, or spam.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>A list of the user's blogs. An empty array if the user doesn't exist or belongs to no blogs.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_body_class"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_body_class" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_body_class .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the classes for the body element as an array.</h2> <pre>get_body_class(string | array $class) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$class</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>One or more classes to add to the class list.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Array of classes.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_bookmark"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_bookmark" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_bookmark .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve Bookmark data</h2> <pre>get_bookmark(mixed $bookmark, string $output, string $filter) : array | object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$bookmark</h4> <code>mixed</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Either OBJECT, ARRAY_N, or ARRAY_A constant</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filter</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is 'raw'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code><code>object</code>Type returned depends on $output value.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_bookmark_field"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_bookmark_field" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_bookmark_field .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve single bookmark data item or field.</h2> <pre>get_bookmark_field(string $field, int $bookmark, string $context) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_bookmark()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\sanitize_bookmark_field()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$field</h4> <code>string</code><p>The name of the data field to return</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$bookmark</h4> <code>int</code><p>The bookmark ID to get field</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$context</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. The context of how the field will be used.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_bookmarks"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_bookmarks" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_bookmarks .collapse"> <h2>Retrieves the list of bookmarks</h2> <pre>get_bookmarks(string | array $args) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Attempts to retrieve from the cache first based on MD5 hash of arguments. If that fails, then the query will be built from the arguments and executed. The results will be stored to the cache.</p> <p>List of default arguments are as follows: 'orderby' - Default is 'name' (string). How to order the links by. String is based off of the bookmark scheme. 'order' - Default is 'ASC' (string). Either 'ASC' or 'DESC'. Orders in either ascending or descending order. 'limit' - Default is -1 (integer) or show all. The amount of bookmarks to display. 'category' - Default is empty string (string). Include the links in what category ID(s). 'category_name' - Default is empty string (string). Get links by category name. 'hide_invisible' - Default is 1 (integer). Whether to show (default) or hide links marked as 'invisible'. 'show_updated' - Default is 0 (integer). Will show the time of when the bookmark was last updated. 'include' - Default is empty string (string). Include bookmark ID(s) separated by commas. 'exclude' - Default is empty string (string). Exclude bookmark ID(s) separated by commas.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/get_bookmarks">http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/get_bookmarks</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>List of arguments to overwrite the defaults</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>List of bookmark row objects</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_boundary_post"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_boundary_post" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_boundary_post .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve boundary post.</h2> <pre>get_boundary_post(bool $in_same_cat, array | string $excluded_categories, bool $start) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Boundary being either the first or last post by publish date within the constraints specified by $in_same_cat or $excluded_categories.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$in_same_cat</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Whether returned post should be in a same category.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$excluded_categories</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Optional. Array or comma-separated list of excluded category IDs.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$start</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Whether to retrieve first or last post.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>object</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_boundary_post_rel_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_boundary_post_rel_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_boundary_post_rel_link .collapse"> <h2>Get boundary post relational link.</h2> <pre>get_boundary_post_rel_link(string $title, bool $in_same_cat, string $excluded_categories, bool $start) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Can either be start or end post relational link.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>3.3.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$title</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Link title format.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$in_same_cat</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Whether link should be in a same category.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$excluded_categories</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Excluded categories IDs.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$start</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is true. Whether to display link to first or last post.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_broken_themes"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_broken_themes" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_broken_themes .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>get_broken_themes() : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_calendar"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_calendar" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_calendar .collapse"> <h2>Display calendar with days that have posts as links.</h2> <pre>get_calendar(bool $initial, bool $echo) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The calendar is cached, which will be retrieved, if it exists. Also all categories will be updated to be backwards compatible with pre-2.3 plugins and themes.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_terms()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/get_categories">http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/get_categories</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Change the defaults retrieving categories.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>List of categories.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_category"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_category" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_category .collapse"> <h2>Retrieves category data given a category ID or category object.</h2> <pre>get_category(int | object $category, string $output, string $filter) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If you pass the $category parameter an object, which is assumed to be the category row object retrieved the database. It will cache the category data.</p> <p>If you pass $category an integer of the category ID, then that category will be retrieved from the database, if it isn't already cached, and pass it back.</p> <p>If you look at get_term(), then both types will be passed through several filters and finally sanitized based on the $filter parameter value.</p> <p>The category will converted to maintain backwards compatibility.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.1</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_term()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$category</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>Category ID or Category row object</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Constant OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filter</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Default is raw or no WordPress defined filter will applied.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Category data in type defined by $output parameter.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_category_by_path"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_category_by_path" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_category_by_path .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve category based on URL containing the category slug.</h2> <pre>get_category_by_path(string $category_path, bool $full_match, string $output) : null | object | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Breaks the $category_path parameter up to get the category slug.</p> <p>Tries to find the child path and will return it. If it doesn't find a match, then it will return the first category matching slug, if $full_match, is set to false. If it does not, then it will return null.</p> <p>It is also possible that it will return a WP_Error object on failure. Check for it when using this function.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$category_path</h4> <code>string</code><p>URL containing category slugs.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$full_match</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Whether full path should be matched.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Constant OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>null</code><code>object</code><code>array</code>Null on failure. Type is based on $output value.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_category_by_slug"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_category_by_slug" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_category_by_slug .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve category object by category slug.</h2> <pre>get_category_by_slug(string $slug) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$slug</h4> <code>string</code><p>The category slug.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>Category data object</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_category_children"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_category_children" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_category_children .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve category children list separated before and after the term IDs.</h2> <pre>get_category_children(int $id, string $before, string $after, array $visited) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>2.8</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use get_term_children()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_term_children()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Category ID to retrieve children.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$before</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Prepend before category term ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$after</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is empty string. Append after category term ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$visited</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. Category Term IDs that have already been added.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_category_feed_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_category_feed_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_category_feed_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the feed link for a category.</h2> <pre>get_category_feed_link(int $cat_id, string $feed) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Returns a link to the feed for all posts in a given category. A specific feed can be requested or left blank to get the default feed.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Feed.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Feed</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$cat_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>ID of a category.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$feed</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Most assume that their email address will not appear in raw form on the blog. If the URL does exist then the URL will be used and the $linktext will be ignored.</p> <p>Encapsulate the HTML link between the $before and $after. So it will appear in the order of $before, link, and finally $after.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> $before and $after parameters</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_comment_class"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_comment_class" data-toggle="collapse" clickable function function_get_comment_count" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_comment_count .collapse"> <h2>The amount of comments in a post or total comments.</h2> <pre>get_comment_count(int $post_id) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>A lot like <a href="wp_count_comments()">wp_count_comments()</a>, in that they both return comment stats (albeit with different types). The <a href="wp_count_comments()">wp_count_comments()</a> actual caches, but this function does not.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Optional.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The comment's date</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_comment_excerpt"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_comment_excerpt" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_comment_excerpt .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the excerpt of the current comment.</h2> <pre>get_comment_excerpt(int $comment_ID) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Will cut each word and only output the first 20 words with '...' at the end. If the word count is less than 20, then no truncating is done and no '...' will appear.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$comment</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$comment_ID</h4> <code>int</code><p>The ID of the comment for which to get the excerpt. The 'login_text' argument will be used, if the user must log in or register first before posting a comment. The 'reply_text' will be used, if they can post a reply. The 'add_below' and 'respond_id' arguments are for the JavaScript moveAddCommentForm() function parameters.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. <pre>get_current_user_id() : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_get_current_user</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>int</code>The current user's ID</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_currentuserinfo"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_currentuserinfo" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_currentuserinfo .collapse"> <h2>Populate global variables with information about the currently logged in user.</h2> <pre>get_currentuserinfo() : bool | null</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Will set the current user, if the current user is not set. The current user will be set to the logged in person. If no user is logged in, then it will set the current user to 0, which is invalid and won't have any permissions.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$current_user</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_validate_auth_cookie()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>null</code>False on XMLRPC Request and invalid auth cookie. Null when current user set</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_custom_header"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_custom_header" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_custom_header .collapse"> <h2>Get the header image data.</h2> <pre>get_custom_header() : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.4.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>object</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_dashboard_blog"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_dashboard_blog" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_dashboard_blog .collapse"> <h2>Get the "dashboard blog", the blog where users without a blog edit their profile data.</h2> <pre>get_dashboard_blog() : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_blog_details()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>int</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_dashboard_url"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_dashboard_url" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_dashboard_url .collapse"> <h2>Get the URL to the user's dashboard.</h2> <pre>get_dashboard_url(int $user_id, string $path, string $scheme) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If a user does not belong to any site, the global user dashboard is used. If the user belongs to the current site, the dashboard for the current site is returned. If the user cannot edit the current site, the dashboard to the user's primary blog is returned.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$user_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>User ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$path</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional path relative to the dashboard. Use only paths known to both blog and user admins.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$scheme</h4> <code>string</code><p>The scheme to use. Default is 'admin', which obeys force_ssl_admin() and is_ssl(). 'http' or 'https' can be passed to force those schemes.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Dashboard url link with optional path appended.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_date_from_gmt"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_date_from_gmt" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_date_from_gmt .collapse"> <h2>Converts a GMT date into the correct format for the blog.</h2> <pre>get_date_from_gmt(string $string, string $format) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Requires and returns in the Y-m-d H:i:s format. Simply adds the value of gmt_offset.Return format can be overridden using the $format parameter</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$string</h4> <code>string</code><p>The date to be converted.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$format</h4> <code>string</code><p>The format string for the returned date (default is Y-m-d H:i:s)</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Formatted date relative to the GMT offset.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_date_template"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_date_template" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_date_template .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve path of date template in current or parent template.</h2> <pre>get_date_template() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_day_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_day_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_day_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the permalink for the day archives with year and month.</h2> <pre>get_day_link(bool | int $year, bool | int $month, bool | int $day) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$year</h4> <code>bool</code><code>int</code><p>False for current year. Specifically because without filtering anyone with the edit_users capability can edit others to be administrators, even if they are only editors or authors. This filter allows admins to delegate user management.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_editable_user_ids"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_editable_user_ids" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_editable_user_ids .collapse"> <h2>get_editable_user_ids() </h2> <pre>get_editable_user_ids(int $user_id, bool $exclude_zeros, $post_type) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$user_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>User ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$exclude_zeros</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is true. Whether to exclude zeros.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$post_type</h4></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_enclosed"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_enclosed" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_enclosed .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve enclosures already enclosed for a post.</h2> <pre>get_enclosed(int $post_id) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Post ID.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>List of enclosures</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_extended"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_extended" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_extended .collapse"> <h2>Get extended entry info (<!--more-->).</h2> <pre>get_extended(string $post) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>There should not be any space after the second dash and before the word 'more'. There can be text or space(s) after the word 'more', but won't be referenced.</p> <p>The returned array has 'main', 'extended', and 'more_text' keys. Main has the text before the</p> <pre><code><!--more--></code></pre> <p>. The 'extended' key has the content after the</p> <pre><code><!--more--></code></pre> <p>comment. The 'more_text' key has the custom "Read More" text.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>string</code><p>Post content.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Post before ('main'), after ('extended'), and custom readmore ('more_text').</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_feed_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_feed_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_feed_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the permalink for the feed type.</h2> <pre>get_feed_link(string $feed) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$feed</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, defaults to default feed. Feed type.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_file"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_file" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_file .collapse"> <h2>get_file() </h2> <pre>get_file($path) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$path</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_file"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_file" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_file .collapse"> <h2>get_file() </h2> <pre>get_file($path) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$path</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_file"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_file" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_file .collapse"> <h2>get_file() </h2> <pre>get_file($path) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$path</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_file_data"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_file_data" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_file_data .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve metadata from a file.</h2> <pre>get_file_data(string $file, array $default_headers, string $context) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Searches for metadata in the first 8kiB of a file, such as a plugin or theme. Each piece of metadata must be on its own line. Fields can not span multiple lines, the value will get cut at the end of the first line.</p> <p>If the file data is not within that first 8kiB, then the author should correct their plugin file and move the data headers to the top.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\http://codex.wordpress.org/File_Header</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> <code>string</code><p>Path to the file</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$default_headers</h4> <code>array</code><p>List of headers, in the format array('HeaderKey' => 'Header Name')</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$context</h4> <code>string</code><p>If specified adds filter hook "extra_{$context}_headers"</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_file_description"></a><div class="element clickable function WordPress files</h2> <pre>get_file_description(string $file) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> id="function_get_filesystem_method"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_filesystem_method" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_filesystem_method .collapse"> <h2>Determines which Filesystem Method to use.</h2> <pre>get_filesystem_method(array $args, string $context) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The priority of the Transports are: Direct, SSH2, FTP PHP Extension, FTP Sockets (Via Sockets class, or fsockopen())</p> <p>Note that the return value of this function can be overridden in 2 ways - By defining FS_METHOD in your</p> <pre><code>wp-config.php</code></pre> <p>file - By using the filesystem_method filter Valid values for these are: 'direct', 'ssh', 'ftpext' or 'ftpsockets' Plugins may also define a custom transport handler, See the WP_Filesystem function for more information.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><p>Connection details.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$context</h4> <code>string</code><p>Full path to the directory that is tested for being writable.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The transport to use, see description for valid return values.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_footer"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_footer" <a id="function_get_gmt_from_date"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_gmt_from_date" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_gmt_from_date .collapse"> <h2>Returns a date in the GMT equivalent.</h2> <pre>get_gmt_from_date(string $string, string $format) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Requires and returns a date in the Y-m-d H:i:s format. Simply subtracts the value of the 'gmt_offset' option. Return format can be overridden using the $format parameter. The DateTime and DateTimeZone classes are used to respect time zone differences in DST.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> version of the date provided.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_header"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_header" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_image_tag .collapse"> <h2>An <img src /> tag for an image attachment, scaling it down if requested.</h2> <pre>get_image_tag(int $id, string $alt, string $title, string $align, string $size) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The filter 'get_image_tag_class' allows for changing the class name for the image without having to use regular expressions on the HTML content. The parameters are: what WordPress will use for the class, the Attachment ID, image align value, and the size the image should be.</p> <p>The second filter 'get_image_tag' has the HTML content, which can then be further manipulated by a plugin to change all attribute values and even HTML content.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Attachment ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$alt</h4> <code>string</code><p>Image Description for the alt attribute.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$title</h4> <code>string</code><p>Image Description for the title attribute.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$align</h4> <code>string</code><p>Part of the class name for aligning the image.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$size</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Default is 'medium'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>HTML IMG element for given image attachment</div> </div></div> </div> <a table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$deprecated</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Not used</p></div> <div class="subelement The 'blog' value is the date when the last post was posted. The 'gmt' is when the last post was posted in GMT formatted date.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$timezone</h4> <code>string</code><p>The location to get the time. Can be 'gmt', 'blog', or 'server'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The date of the last post.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_lastpostmodified"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_lastpostmodified" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_lastpostmodified .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve last post modified date depending on timezone.</h2> <pre>get_lastpostmodified(string $timezone) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The server timezone is the default and is the difference between GMT and server time. The 'blog' value is just when the last post was modified. The 'gmt' is when the last post was modified in GMT time.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$timezone</h4> <code>string</code><p>The location to get the time. Can be 'gmt', 'blog', or 'server'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The date the post was last modified.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve bookmark data based on ID.</h2> If no category supplied uses all</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$orderby</h4> <code>string</code><p>the order to output the links. E.g. 'id', 'name', 'url', 'description', or 'rating'. Or maybe owner. If you start the name with an underscore the order will be reversed. You can also specify 'rand' as the order which will return links in a random order.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$limit</h4> <code>int</code><p>Limit to X entries. If not specified, all entries are shown.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_linkobjectsbyname"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_linkobjectsbyname" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_linkobjectsbyname .collapse"> <h2>Gets an array of link objects associated with category $cat_name.</h2> <pre>get_linkobjectsbyname(string $cat_name, string $orderby, int $limit) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><pre><code>$links = get_linkobjectsbyname('fred'); foreach ($links as $link) { echo '<li>'.$link->link_name.'</li>'; } </code></pre></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.1</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>2.1</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use get_bookmarks()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_bookmarks()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$cat_name</h4> <code>string</code><p>The category name to use. Or maybe owner. If you start the name with an underscore the order will be reversed. You can also specify 'rand' as the order which will return links in a random order.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$limit</h4> <code>int</code><p>Limit to X entries. If not specified, all entries are shown.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$show_updated</h4> <code>int</code><p>Whether to show last updated timestamp</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_locale"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_locale" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_locale .collapse"> <h2>Gets the current locale.</h2> <pre>get_locale() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If the locale is set, then it will filter the locale in the 'locale' filter hook and return the value.</p> <p>If the locale is not set already, then the WPLANG constant is used if it is defined. Then it is filtered through the 'locale' filter hook and the value for the locale global set and the locale is returned.</p> <p>The process to get the locale should only be done once, but the locale will always be filtered using the 'locale' hook.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$locale</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The locale of the blog or from the 'locale' hook.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_locale_stylesheet_uri"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_locale_stylesheet_uri" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_locale_stylesheet_uri .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve localized stylesheet URI.</h2> <pre>get_locale_stylesheet_uri() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The stylesheet directory for the localized stylesheet files are located, by default, in the base theme directory. The name of the locale file will be the locale followed by '.css'. If that does not exist, then the text direction stylesheet will be checked for existence, for example 'ltr.css'.</p> <p>The theme may change the location of the stylesheet directory by either using the 'stylesheet_directory_uri' filter or the 'locale_stylesheet_uri' filter. If you want to change the location of the stylesheet files for the entire WordPress workflow, then change the former. If you just have the locale in a separate folder, then change the latter.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_magic_quotes"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_magic_quotes" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_magic_quotes .collapse"> <h2>get_magic_quotes() </h2> <pre>get_magic_quotes() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_manifest"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_manifest" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_manifest .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve list of all cacheable WP files</h2> <pre>get_manifest() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"><p>Array format: file, version (optional), bool (whether to use src and set ignoreQuery, defaults to true)</p></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_media_item"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_media_item" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_media_item .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve HTML form for modifying the image attachment.</h2> <pre>get_media_item(int $attachment_id, string | array $args) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attachment_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Attachment ID for modification.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Override defaults.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>HTML form for attachment.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_media_items"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_media_items" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_media_items .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve HTML for media items of post gallery.</h2> <pre>get_media_items(int $post_id, array $errors) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The HTML markup retrieved will be created for the progress of SWF Upload component. Will also create link for showing and hiding the form to modify the image attachment.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$errors</h4> <code>array</code><p>Errors for attachment, if any.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_meta_keys"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_meta_keys" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_meta_keys .collapse"> <h2>Get a list of previously defined keys.</h2> <pre>get_meta_keys() : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div ?></code></pre> <p>Should result in</p> <pre><code>Array('category', 'post_tag')</code></pre></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_taxonomies</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$object</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><code>object</code><p>Name of the type of taxonomy object, or an object (row from posts)</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of output to return, either taxonomy 'names' or 'objects'. 'names' is the default.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>The names of all taxonomy of $object_type.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_object_term_cache"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_object_term_cache" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_object_term_cache .collapse"> <h2>Retrieves the taxonomy relationship to the term object id.</h2> <pre>get_object_term_cache(int | array $id, string $taxonomy) : bool | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_cache_get()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><code>array</code><p>Term object ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy Name</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>array</code>Empty array if $terms found, but not $taxonomy. False if nothing is in cache for $taxonomy and $id.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_objects_in_term"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_objects_in_term" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_objects_in_term .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve object_ids of valid taxonomy and term.</h2> <pre>get_objects_in_term(int | array $term_ids, string | array $taxonomies, array | string $args) : <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a> | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The strings of $taxonomies must exist before this function will continue. On failure of finding a valid taxonomy, it will return an WP_Error class, kind of like Exceptions in PHP 5, except you can't catch them. Even so, you can still test for the WP_Error class and get the error message.</p> <p>The $terms aren't checked the same as $taxonomies, but still need to exist for $object_ids to be returned.</p> <p>It is possible to change the order that object_ids is returned by either using PHP sort family functions or using the database by using $args with either ASC or DESC array. The value should be in the key named 'order'.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_parse_args()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$term_ids</h4> <code>int</code><code>array</code><p>Term id or array of term ids of terms that will be used</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomies</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>String of taxonomy name or Array of string values of taxonomy names</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Change the order of the object_ids, either ASC or DESC</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code><code>array</code>If the taxonomy does not exist, then WP_Error will be returned. On success the array can be empty meaning that there are no $object_ids found or it will return the $object_ids found.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_option"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_option" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_option .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve option value based on name of option.</h2> <pre>get_option(string $option, mixed $default) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If the option does not exist or does not have a value, then the return value will be false. This is useful to check whether you need to install an option and is commonly used during installation of plugin options and to test whether upgrading is required.</p> <p>If the option was serialized then it will be unserialized when it is returned.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Option.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Option</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$option</h4> <code>string</code><p>Name of option to retrieve. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$default</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Optional. Default value to return if the option does not exist.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Value set for the option.</div> </div></div> </div> <a OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filter</h4> <code>string</code><p>How the return value should be filtered.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Page data.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_page_by_path"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_page_by_path" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_page_by_path .collapse"> <h2>Retrieves a page given its path.</h2> <pre>get_page_by_path(string $page_path, string $output, string $post_type) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$page_path</h4> <code>string</code><p>Page path</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Default page.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Null when complete.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_page_by_title"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_page_by_title" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_page_by_title .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve a page given its title.</h2> <pre>get_page_by_title(string $page_title, string $output, string $post_type) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$page_title</h4> <code>string</code><p>Page title</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Output type. OBJECT, ARRAY_N, or ARRAY_A. Default OBJECT.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Post type. Default page.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>mixed</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_page_children"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_page_children" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_page_children .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve child pages from list of pages matching page ID.</h2> <pre>get_page_children(int $page_id, array $pages) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Matches against the pages parameter against the page ID. Also matches all children for the same to retrieve all children of a page. Does not make any SQL queries to get the children.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.1</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$page_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Page ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$pages</h4> <code>array</code><p>List of pages' objects.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>array</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_page_hierarchy"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_page_hierarchy" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_page_hierarchy .collapse"> <h2>Order the pages with children under parents in a flat list.</h2> <pre>get_page_hierarchy(array $pages, int $page_id) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>It uses auxiliary structure to hold parent-children relationships and runs in O(N) complexity</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$pages</h4> <code>array</code><p>Posts array.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$page_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Parent page ID.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>A list arranged by hierarchy.
