Link title format.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_pending_comments_num"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_pending_comments_num" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_pending_comments_num .collapse"> <h2>Get the number of pending comments on a post or posts</h2> <pre>get_pending_comments_num(int | array $post_id) : int | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><code>array</code><p>Either a single Post ID or an array of Post IDs</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>int</code><code>array</code>Either a single Posts pending comments as an int or an array of ints keyed on the Post IDs</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_permalink"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_permalink" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_permalink .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve full permalink for current post or post ID.</h2> <pre>get_permalink(int $id, bool $leavename) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$leavename</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, defaults to false. Whether to keep post name or page name.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_plugin_data"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_plugin_data" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_plugin_data .collapse"> <h2>Parse the plugin contents to retrieve plugin's metadata.</h2> <pre>get_plugin_data(string $plugin_file, bool $markup, bool $translate) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The metadata of the plugin's data searches for the following in the plugin's header. All plugin data must be on its own line. For plugin description, it must not have any newlines or only parts of the description will be displayed and the same goes for the plugin data. The below is formatted for printing.</p> <pre><code>/* Plugin Name: Name of Plugin Plugin URI: Link to plugin information Description: Plugin Description Author: Plugin author's name Author URI: Link to the author's web site Version: Must be set in the plugin for WordPress 2.3+ Text Domain: Optional. Unique identifier, should be same as the one used in plugin_text_domain() Domain Path: Optional. Only useful if the translations are located in a folder above the plugin's base path. For example, if .mo files are located in the locale folder then Domain Path will be "/locale/" and must have the first slash. Defaults to the base folder the plugin is located in. Network: Optional. Specify "Network: true" to require that a plugin is activated across all sites in an installation. This will prevent a plugin from being activated on a single site when Multisite is enabled. * / # Remove the space to close comment </code></pre> <p>Plugin data returned array contains the following: 'Name' - Name of the plugin, must be unique. 'Title' - Title of the plugin and the link to the plugin's web site. 'Description' - Description of what the plugin does and/or notes from the author. 'Author' - The author's name 'AuthorURI' - The authors web site address. 'Version' - The plugin version number. 'PluginURI' - Plugin web site address. 'TextDomain' - Plugin's text domain for localization. 'DomainPath' - Plugin's relative directory path to .mo files. 'Network' - Boolean. Whether the plugin can only be activated network wide.</p> <p>Some users have issues with opening large files and manipulating the contents for want is usually the first 1kiB or 2kiB. This function stops pulling in the plugin contents when it has all of the required plugin data.</p> <p>The first 8kiB of the file will be pulled in and if the plugin data is not within that first 8kiB, then the plugin author should correct their plugin and move the plugin data headers to the top.</p> <p>The plugin file is assumed to have permissions to allow for scripts to read the file. This is not checked however and the file is only opened for reading.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/5651">Previous Optimizations.</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/7372">Further and better Optimizations.</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$plugin_file</h4> <code>string</code><p>Path to the plugin file</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$markup</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. If the returned data should have HTML markup applied. Defaults to true.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$translate</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. If the returned data should be translated. Defaults to true.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>See above for description.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_plugin_files"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_plugin_files" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_plugin_files .collapse"> <h2>Get a list of a plugin's files.</h2> <pre>get_plugin_files(string $plugin) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$plugin</h4> <code>string</code><p>Plugin ID</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>List of files relative to the plugin root.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_plugin_page_hook"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_plugin_page_hook" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_plugin_page_hook .collapse"> <h2>get_plugin_page_hook() </h2> <pre>get_plugin_page_hook($plugin_page, $parent_page) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$plugin_page</h4></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$parent_page</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_plugin_page_hookname"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_plugin_page_hookname" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_plugin_page_hookname .collapse"> <h2>get_plugin_page_hookname() </h2> <pre>get_plugin_page_hookname($plugin_page, $parent_page) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$plugin_page</h4></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$parent_page</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_plugin_updates"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_plugin_updates" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_plugin_updates .collapse"> <h2>get_plugin_updates() </h2> <pre>get_plugin_updates() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_plugins"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_plugins" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_plugins .collapse"> <h2>Check the plugins directory and retrieve all plugin files with plugin data.</h2> <pre>get_plugins(string $plugin_folder) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>WordPress only supports plugin files in the base plugins directory (wp-content/plugins) and in one directory above the plugins directory (wp-content/plugins/my-plugin). The file it looks for has the plugin data and must be found in those two locations. It is recommended that do keep your plugin files in directories.</p> <p>The file with the plugin data is the file that will be included and therefore needs to have the main execution for the plugin. This does not mean everything must be contained in the file and it is recommended that the file be split for maintainability. Keep everything in one file for extreme optimization purposes.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$plugin_folder</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Relative path to single plugin folder.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Key is the plugin file path and the value is an array of the plugin data.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post .collapse"> <h2>Retrieves post data given a post ID or post object.</h2> <pre>get_post(int | object $post, string $output, string $filter) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>See <a href="sanitize_post()">sanitize_post()</a> for optional $filter values. Also, the parameter $post, must be given as a variable, since it is passed by reference.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.1</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/get_post">http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/get_post</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>Post ID or post object.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is Object. Either OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filter</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is raw.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Post data</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_ancestors"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_ancestors" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_ancestors .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve ancestors of a post.</h2> <pre>get_post_ancestors(int | object $post) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>Post ID or post object</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Ancestor IDs or empty array if none are found.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_class"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_class" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_class .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the classes for the post div as an array.</h2> <pre>get_post_class(string | array $class, int $post_id) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The class names are add are many. If the post is a sticky, then the 'sticky' class name. The class 'hentry' is always added to each post. For each category, the class will be added with 'category-' with category slug is added. The tags are the same way as the categories with 'tag-' before the tag slug. All classes are passed through the filter, 'post_class' with the list of classes, followed by $class parameter value, with the post ID as the last parameter.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$class</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>One or more classes to add to the class list.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>An optional post ID.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Array of classes.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_comments_feed_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_comments_feed_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_comments_feed_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the permalink for the post comments feed.</h2> <pre>get_post_comments_feed_link(int $post_id, string $feed) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.2.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$feed</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Feed type.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_custom"></a><div class="element clickable function The 'login_text' argument will be used, if the user must log in or register first before posting a comment. The 'reply_text' will be used, if they can post a reply. The 'add_below' and 'respond_id' arguments are for the JavaScript moveAddCommentForm() function parameters.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. Defaults to current post.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code>bool</code><code>null</code>Link to show comment form, if successful. False, if comments are closed.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_stati"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_stati" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_stati .collapse"> <h2>Get a list of all registered post status objects.</h2> <pre>get_post_stati(array | string $args, string $output, string $operator) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Post.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Post</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_post_statuses</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\register_post_status</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_post_status_object</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>An array of key => value arguments to match against the post status objects.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of output to return, either post status 'names' or 'objects'. 'names' is the default.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$operator</h4> <code>string</code><p>The logical operation to perform. 'or' means only one element from the array needs to match; 'and' means all elements must match. The default is 'and'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>A list of post status names or objects</div> </div></div> </div> <a class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> Post ID</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>array</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_thumbnail_id"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_thumbnail_id" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_thumbnail_id .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve Post Thumbnail ID.</h2> <pre>get_post_thumbnail_id(int $post_id) : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>int</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_time"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_time" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_time .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the time at which the post was written.</h2> <pre>get_post_time(string $d, bool $gmt, int | object $post, bool $translate) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$d</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional Either 'G', 'U', or php date format.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$gmt</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. Default is global $post object.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$translate</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to translate the time string</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_to_edit"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_to_edit" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_to_edit .collapse"> <h2>Get an existing post and format it for editing.</h2> <pre>get_post_to_edit(\unknown_type $id) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_type"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_type" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_type .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the post type of the current post or of a given post.</h2> <pre>get_post_type(mixed $the_post) : bool | string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$post</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$the_post</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Optional. Post object or post ID.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>string</code>post type or false on failure.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_type_archive_feed_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_type_archive_feed_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_type_archive_feed_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the permalink for a post type archive feed.</h2> <pre>get_post_type_archive_feed_link(string $post_type, string $feed) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>Post type</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$feed</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Feed type</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_type_archive_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_type_archive_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_type_archive_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the permalink for a post type archive.</h2> <pre>get_post_type_archive_link(string $post_type) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>Post type</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_type_capabilities"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_type_capabilities" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_type_capabilities .collapse"> <h2>Builds an object with all post type capabilities out of a post type object</h2> <pre>get_post_type_capabilities(object $args) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Post type capabilities use the 'capability_type' argument as a base, if the capability is not set in the 'capabilities' argument array or if the 'capabilities' argument is not supplied.</p> <p>The capability_type argument can optionally be registered as an array, with the first value being singular and the second plural, e.g. array('story, 'stories') Otherwise, an 's' will be added to the value for the plural form. After registration, capability_type will always be a string of the singular value.</p> <p>By default, seven keys are accepted as part of the capabilities array:</p> <ul> <li><p>edit_post, read_post, and delete_post are meta capabilities, which are then generally mapped to corresponding primitive capabilities depending on the context, which would be the post being edited/read/deleted and the user or role being checked. Thus these capabilities would generally not be granted directly to users or roles.</p></li> <li><p>edit_posts - Controls whether objects of this post type can be edited.</p></li> <li>edit_others_posts - Controls whether objects of this type owned by other users can be edited. If the post type does not support an author, then this will behave like edit_posts.</li> <li>publish_posts - Controls publishing objects of this post type.</li> <li>read_private_posts - Controls whether private objects can be read.</li> </ul> <p>These four primitive capabilities are checked in core in various locations. There are also seven other primitive capabilities which are not referenced directly in core, except in map_meta_cap(), which takes the three aforementioned meta capabilities and translates them into one or more primitive capabilities that must then be checked against the user or role, depending on the context.</p> <ul> <li>read - Controls whether objects of this post type can be read.</li> <li>delete_posts - Controls whether objects of this post type can be deleted.</li> <li>delete_private_posts - Controls whether private objects can be deleted.</li> <li>delete_published_posts - Controls whether published objects can be deleted.</li> <li>delete_others_posts - Controls whether objects owned by other users can be can be deleted. If the post type does not support an author, then this will behave like delete_posts.</li> <li>edit_private_posts - Controls whether private objects can be edited.</li> <li>edit_published_posts - Controls whether published objects can be edited.</li> </ul> <p>These additional capabilities are only used in map_meta_cap(). Thus, they are only assigned by default if the post type is registered with the 'map_meta_cap' argument set to true (default is false).</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\map_meta_cap()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>object</code><p>Post type registration arguments</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>object with all the capabilities as member variables</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_type_labels"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_type_labels" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_type_labels .collapse"> <h2>Builds an object with all post type labels out of a post type object</h2> <pre>get_post_type_labels(object $post_type_object) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Accepted keys of the label array in the post type object: - name - general name for the post type, usually plural. The same and overridden by $post_type_object->label. Default is Posts/Pages - singular_name - name for one object of this post type. Default is Post/Page - add_new - Default is Add New for both hierarchical and non-hierarchical types. When internationalizing this string, please use a <a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/I18n_for_WordPress_Developers#Disambiguation_by_context">gettext context</a> matching your post type. Example:</p> <pre><code>_x('Add New', 'product');</code></pre> <ul> <li>add_new_item - Default is Add New Post/Add New Page</li> <li>edit_item - Default is Edit Post/Edit Page</li> <li>new_item - Default is New Post/New Page</li> <li>view_item - Default is View Post/View Page</li> <li>search_items - Default is Search Posts/Search Pages</li> <li>not_found - Default is No posts found/No pages found</li> <li>not_found_in_trash - Default is No posts found in Trash/No pages found in Trash</li> <li>parent_item_colon - This string isn't used on non-hierarchical types. In hierarchical ones the default is Parent Page:</li> <li>all_items - String for the submenu. Default is All Posts/All Pages</li> <li>menu_name - Default is the same as </li> </ul> <pre><code>name</code></pre> <p>Above, the first default value is for non-hierarchical post types (like posts) and the second one is for hierarchical post types (like pages).</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_type_object</h4> <code>object</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>object with all the labels as member variables</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_type_object"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_type_object" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_type_object .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve a post type object by name</h2> <pre>get_post_type_object(string $post_type) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Post.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Post</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_post_types</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\register_post_type</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_post_types</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>The name of a registered post type</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>A post type object</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_post_types"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_post_types" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_post_types .collapse"> <h2>Get a list of all registered post type objects.</h2> <pre>get_post_types(array | string $args, string $output, string $operator) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Post.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Post</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_post_types</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\register_post_type</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>An array of key => value arguments to match against the post type objects.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of output to return, either post type 'names' or 'objects'. 'names' is the default.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$operator</h4> <code>string</code><p>The logical operation to perform. 'or' means only one element from the array needs to match; 'and' means all elements must match. The default is 'and'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>A list of post type names or objects</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_postdata"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_postdata" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_postdata .collapse"> <h2>Entire Post data.</h2> <pre>get_postdata(int $postid) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>1.5.1</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use get_post()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_post()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$postid</h4> <code>int</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>array</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_posts"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_posts" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_posts .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve list of latest posts or posts matching criteria.</h2> <pre>get_posts(array $args) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The defaults are as follows: 'numberposts' - Default is 5. Total number of posts to retrieve. 'offset' - Default is 0. See <a href="WP_Query::query()">WP_Query::query()</a> for more. 'category' - What category to pull the posts from. 'orderby' - Default is 'post_date'. How to order the posts. 'order' - Default is 'DESC'. The order to retrieve the posts. 'include' - See <a href="WP_Query::query()">WP_Query::query()</a> for more. 'exclude' - See <a href="WP_Query::query()">WP_Query::query()</a> for more. 'meta_key' - See <a href="WP_Query::query()">WP_Query::query()</a> for more. 'meta_value' - See <a href="WP_Query::query()">WP_Query::query()</a> for more. 'post_type' - Default is 'post'. Can be 'page', or 'attachment' to name a few. 'post_parent' - The parent of the post or post type. 'post_status' - Default is 'publish'. Post status to retrieve.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\WP_Query::query()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/get_posts">http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/get_posts</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. Overrides defaults.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>List of posts.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_posts_by_author_sql"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_posts_by_author_sql" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_posts_by_author_sql .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the post SQL based on capability, author, and type.</h2> <pre>get_posts_by_author_sql(string $post_type, bool $full, int $post_author) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_private_posts_cap_sql()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>Post type.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$full</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. The function will return a piece of SQL code that can be added to a WHERE clause; this SQL is constructed to allow all published posts, and all private posts to which the user has access.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$user_ID</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> where clause.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_profile"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_profile" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_profile .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve user data based on field.</h2> <pre>get_profile($field, $user) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use get_the_author_meta()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_the_author_meta()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$field</h4></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$user</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_pung"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_pung" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_pung .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve URLs already pinged for a post.</h2> <pre>get_pung(int $post_id) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> If it doesn't exist, then the default search form will be displayed. The default search form is HTML, which will be displayed. There is a filter applied to the search form HTML in order to edit or replace it. The filter is 'get_search_form'.</p> <p>This function is primarily used by themes which want to hardcode the search form into the sidebar and also by the search widget in WordPress.</p> <p>There is also an action that is called whenever the function is run called, 'get_search_form'. This can be useful for outputting JavaScript that the search relies on or various formatting that applies to the beginning of the search. To give a few examples of what it can be used for.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$echo</h4> <code>boolean</code><p>Default to echo and not return the form.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_search_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_search_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_search_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve permalink for search.</h2> <pre>get_search_link(string $query) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$query</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. The query string to use. If empty the current query is used.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_search_query"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_search_query" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_search_query .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the contents of the search WordPress query variable.</h2> <pre>get_search_query(bool $escaped) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The search query string is passed through <a href="esc_attr()">esc_attr()</a> to ensure that it is safe for placing in an html attribute.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\esc_attr()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$escaped</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether the result is escaped. <pre>get_settings(string $option) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>2.1</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use get_option()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_settings_errors"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_settings_errors" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_settings_errors .collapse"> <h2>Fetch settings errors registered by add_settings_error()</h2> <pre>get_settings_errors(string $setting, boolean $sanitize) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Checks the $wp_settings_errors array for any errors declared during the current pageload and returns them.</p> <p>If changes were just submitted ($_GET['settings-updated']) and settings errors were saved to the 'settings_errors' transient then those errors will be returned instead. This is used to pass errors back across pageloads.</p> <p>Use the $sanitize argument to manually re-sanitize the option before returning errors. This is useful if you have errors or notices you want to show even when the user hasn't submitted data (i.e. when they first load an options page, or in admin_notices action hook)</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>global</th> <td>array $wp_settings_errors Storage array of errors registered during this pageload</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$setting</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional slug title of a specific setting who's errors you want.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$sanitize</h4> <code>boolean</code><p>Whether to re-sanitize the setting value before returning errors.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Array of settings errors</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_shortcode_regex"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_shortcode_regex" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_shortcode_regex .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the shortcode regular expression for searching.</h2> <pre>get_shortcode_regex() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The regular expression combines the shortcode tags in the regular expression in a regex class.</p> <p>The regular expression contains 6 different sub matches to help with parsing.</p> <p>1 - An extra [ to allow for escaping shortcodes with double [[]] 2 - The shortcode name 3 - The shortcode argument list 4 - The self closing / 5 - The content of a shortcode when it wraps some content. 6 - An extra ] to allow for escaping shortcodes with double [[]]</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$shortcode_tags</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The shortcode search regular expression</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_shortcut_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_shortcut_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_shortcut_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the Press This bookmarklet link.</h2> <pre>get_shortcut_link() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_sidebar"></a><div class="element clickable function <h2>get_site_allowed_themes() </h2> <pre>get_site_allowed_themes() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_site_option"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_site_option" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_site_option .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve site option value based on name of option.</h2> <pre>get_site_option(string $option, mixed $default, bool $use_cache) : mixed</pre> <div id="function_get_submit_button"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_submit_button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_submit_button .collapse"> <h2>Returns a submit button, with provided text and appropriate class</h2> <pre>get_submit_button(string $text, string $type, string $name, bool $wrap, array | string $other_attributes) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$text</h4> <code>string</code><p>The text of the button (defaults to 'Save Changes')</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$type</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of button. One of: primary, secondary, delete</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$name</h4> <code>string</code><p>The HTML name of the submit button. Defaults to "submit". If no id attribute is given in $other_attributes below, $name will be used as the button's id.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$wrap</h4> <code>bool</code><p>True if the output button should be wrapped in a paragraph tag, false otherwise. Defaults to true</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$other_attributes</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Other attributes that should be output with the button, mapping attributes to their values, such as array( 'tabindex' => '1' ). These attributes will be output as attribute="value", such as tabindex="1". Defaults to no other attributes. Other attributes can also be provided as a string such as 'tabindex="1"', though the array format is typically cleaner.</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_super_admins"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_super_admins" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_super_admins .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve a list of super admins.</h2> <pre>get_super_admins() : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$super_admins</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>List of super admin logins</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_tag"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_tag" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_tag .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve post tag by tag ID or tag object.</h2> <pre>get_tag(int | object $tag, string $output, string $filter) : object | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If you pass the $tag parameter an object, which is assumed to be the tag row object retrieved the database. It will cache the tag data.</p> <p>If you pass $tag an integer of the tag ID, then that tag will be retrieved from the database, if it isn't already cached, and pass it back.</p> <p>If you look at get_term(), then both types will be passed through several filters and finally sanitized based on the $filter parameter value.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$tag</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Constant OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filter</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Default is raw or no WordPress defined filter will applied.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code><code>array</code>Return type based on $output value.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_tag_feed_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_tag_feed_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_tag_feed_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve permalink for feed of tag.</h2> <pre>get_tag_feed_link(int $tag_id, string $feed) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$tag_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Tag ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$feed</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. data-target=".function_get_taxonomies .collapse"> <h2>Get a list of registered taxonomy objects.</h2> <pre>get_taxonomies(array $args, string $output, string $operator) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_taxonomies</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\register_taxonomy</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><p>An array of key => value arguments to match against the taxonomy objects.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of output to return, either taxonomy 'names' or 'objects'. 'names' is the default.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$operator</h4> <code>string</code><p>The logical operation to perform. 'or' means only one element from the array needs to match; 'and' means all elements must match. The default is 'and'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>A list of taxonomy names or objects</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_taxonomy"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_taxonomy" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_taxonomy .collapse"> <h2>Retrieves the taxonomy object of $taxonomy.</h2> <pre>get_taxonomy(string $taxonomy) : object | bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The get_taxonomy function will first check that the parameter string given is a taxonomy object and if it is, it will return it.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_taxonomies</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\taxonomy_exists()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Name of taxonomy object to return</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code><code>bool</code>The Taxonomy Object or false if $taxonomy doesn't exist</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_taxonomy_labels"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_taxonomy_labels" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_taxonomy_labels .collapse"> <h2>Builds an object with all taxonomy labels out of a taxonomy object</h2> <pre>get_taxonomy_labels(object $tax) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Accepted keys of the label array in the taxonomy object: - name - general name for the taxonomy, usually plural. The same as and overridden by $tax->label. Default is Tags/Categories - singular_name - name for one object of this taxonomy. Default is Tag/Category - search_items - Default is Search Tags/Search Categories - popular_items - This string isn't used on hierarchical taxonomies. Default is Popular Tags - all_items - Default is All Tags/All Categories - parent_item - This string isn't used on non-hierarchical taxonomies. In hierarchical ones the default is Parent Category - parent_item_colon - The same as</p> <pre><code>parent_item</code></pre> <p>, but with colon</p> <pre><code>:</code></pre> <p>in the end - edit_item - Default is Edit Tag/Edit Category - view_item - Default is View Tag/View Category - update_item - Default is Update Tag/Update Category - add_new_item - Default is Add New Tag/Add New Category - new_item_name - Default is New Tag Name/New Category Name - separate_items_with_commas - This string isn't used on hierarchical taxonomies. Default is "Separate tags with commas", used in the meta box. - add_or_remove_items - This string isn't used on hierarchical taxonomies. Default is "Add or remove tags", used in the meta box when JavaScript is disabled. - choose_from_most_used - This string isn't used on hierarchical taxonomies. Default is "Choose from the most used tags", used in the meta box.</p> <p>Above, the first default value is for non-hierarchical taxonomies (like tags) and the second one is for hierarchical taxonomies (like categories).</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$tax</h4> <code>object</code><p>Taxonomy object</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>object with all the labels as member variables</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_taxonomy_template"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_taxonomy_template" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_taxonomy_template .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve path of taxonomy template in current or parent template.</h2> <pre>get_taxonomy_template() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Retrieves the taxonomy and term, if term is available. The template is prepended with 'taxonomy-' and followed by both the taxonomy string and the taxonomy string followed by a dash and then followed by the term.</p> <p>The taxonomy and term template is checked and used first, if it exists. Second, just the taxonomy template is checked, and then finally, taxonomy.php template is used. If none of the files exist, then it will fall back on to index.php.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_temp_dir"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_temp_dir" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_temp_dir .collapse"> <h2>Determines a writable directory for temporary files.</h2> <pre>get_temp_dir() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Function's preference is to WP_CONTENT_DIR followed by the return value of</p> <pre><code>sys_get_temp_dir()</code></pre> <p>, before finally defaulting to /tmp/</p> <p>In the event that this function does not find a writable location, It may be overridden by the</p> <pre><code>WP_TEMP_DIR</code></pre> <p>constant in your</p> <pre><code>wp-config.php</code></pre> <p>file.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Writable temporary directory</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_template"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_template" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_template .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve name of the current theme.</h2> <pre>get_template() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Template name.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_template_directory"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_template_directory" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_template_directory .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve current theme directory.</h2> <pre>get_template_directory() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Template directory path.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_template_directory_uri"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_template_directory_uri" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_template_directory_uri .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve theme directory URI.</h2> <pre>get_template_directory_uri() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Template directory URI.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_template_part"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_template_part" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_template_part .collapse"> <h2>Load a template part into a template</h2> <pre>get_template_part(string $slug, string $name) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Makes it easy for a theme to reuse sections of code in a easy to overload way for child themes.</p> <p>Includes the named template part for a theme or if a name is specified then a specialised part will be included. If the theme contains no {slug}.php file then no template will be included.</p> <p>The template is included using require, not require_once, so you may include the same template part multiple times.</p> <p>For the $name parameter, if the file is called "{slug}-special.php" then specify "special".</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\locate_template()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$slug</h4> <code>string</code><p>The slug name for the generic template.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$name</h4> <code>string</code><p>The name of the specialised template.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_term"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_term" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_term .collapse"> <h2>Get all Term data from database by Term ID.</h2> <pre>get_term(int | object $term, string $taxonomy, string $output, string $filter) : mixed | null | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The usage of the get_term function is to apply filters to a term object. It is possible to get a term object from the database before applying the filters.</p> <p>$term ID must be part of $taxonomy, to get from the database. Failure, might be able to be captured by the hooks. Failure would be the same value as $wpdb returns for the get_row method.</p> <p>There are two hooks, one is specifically for each term, named 'get_term', and the second is for the taxonomy name, 'term_$taxonomy'. Both hooks gets the term object, and the taxonomy name as parameters. Both hooks are expected to return a Term object.</p> <p>'get_term' hook - Takes two parameters the term Object and the taxonomy name. Must return term object. Used in get_term() as a catch-all filter for every $term.</p> <p>'get_$taxonomy' hook - Takes two parameters the term Object and the taxonomy name. Must return term object. $taxonomy will be the taxonomy name, so for example, if 'category', it would be 'get_category' as the filter name. Useful for custom taxonomies or plugging into default taxonomies.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\sanitize_term()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\sanitize_term_field()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$term</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>If integer, will get from database. If object will apply filters and return $term.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy name that $term is part of.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Constant OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filter</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is raw or no WordPress defined filter will applied.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code><code>null</code><code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code>Term Row from database. Will return null if $term is empty. If taxonomy does not exist then WP_Error will be returned.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_term_by"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_term_by" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_term_by .collapse"> <h2>Get all Term data from database by Term field and data.</h2> <pre>get_term_by(string $field, string | int $value, string $taxonomy, string $output, string $filter) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Warning: $value is not escaped for 'name' $field. You must do it yourself, if required.</p> <p>The default $field is 'id', therefore it is possible to also use null for field, but not recommended that you do so.</p> <p>If $value does not exist, the return value will be false. If $taxonomy exists and $field and $value combinations exist, the Term will be returned.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\sanitize_term()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\sanitize_term_field()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$field</h4> <code>string</code><p>Either 'slug', 'name', or 'id'</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$value</h4> <code>string</code><code>int</code><p>Search for this term value</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy Name</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$output</h4> <code>string</code><p>Constant OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filter</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is raw or no WordPress defined filter will applied.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Term Row from database. Will return false if $taxonomy does not exist or $term was not found.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_term_children"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_term_children" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_term_children .collapse"> <h2>Merge all term children into a single array of their IDs.</h2> <pre>get_term_children(string $term_id, string $taxonomy) : array | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This recursive function will merge all of the children of $term into the same array of term IDs. Only useful for taxonomies which are hierarchical.</p> <p>Will return an empty array if $term does not exist in $taxonomy.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\_get_term_hierarchy()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_term_children()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$term_id</h4> <code>string</code><p>ID of Term to get children</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy Name</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code><code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code>List of Term Objects. WP_Error returned if $taxonomy does not exist</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_term_feed_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_term_feed_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_term_feed_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the feed link for a term.</h2> <pre>get_term_feed_link(int $term_id, string $taxonomy, string $feed) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Returns a link to the feed for all posts in a given term. A specific feed can be requested or left blank to get the default feed.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$term_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>ID of a category.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Feed type.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Link to the feed for the term specified by $term_id and $taxonomy.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_term_field"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_term_field" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_term_field .collapse"> <h2>Get sanitized Term field.</h2> <pre>get_term_field(string $field, int $term, string $taxonomy, string $context) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Does checks for $term, based on the $taxonomy. The function is for contextual reasons and for simplicity of usage. See sanitize_term_field() for more information.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\sanitize_term_field()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$field</h4> <code>string</code><p>Term field to fetch</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$term</h4> <code>int</code><p>Term ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy Name</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$context</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is display. is not set in $term.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_term_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_term_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_term_link .collapse"> <h2>Generates a permalink for a taxonomy term archive.</h2> <pre>get_term_link(object | int | string $term, string $taxonomy) : string | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$term</h4> <code>object</code><code>int</code><code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>(optional if $term is object)</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code>HTML link to taxonomy term archive on success, WP_Error if term does not exist.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_term_to_edit"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_term_to_edit" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_term_to_edit .collapse"> <h2>Sanitizes Term for editing.</h2> <pre>get_term_to_edit(int | object $id, string $taxonomy) : mixed | null | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Return value is sanitize_term() and usage is for sanitizing the term for editing. Function is for contextual and simplicity.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\sanitize_term()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>Term ID or Object</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy Name</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code><code>null</code><code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code>Will return empty string if $term is not an object.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_terms"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_terms" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_terms .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the terms in a given taxonomy or list of taxonomies.</h2> <pre>get_terms(string | array $taxonomies, string | array $args) : array | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>You can fully inject any customizations to the query before it is sent, as well as control the output with a filter.</p> <p>The 'get_terms' filter will be called when the cache has the term and will pass the found term along with the array of $taxonomies and array of $args. This filter is also called before the array of terms is passed and will pass the array of terms, along with the $taxonomies and $args.</p> <p>The 'list_terms_exclusions' filter passes the compiled exclusions along with the $args.</p> <p>The 'get_terms_orderby' filter passes the ORDER BY clause for the query along with the $args array.</p> <p>The 'get_terms_fields' filter passes the fields for the SELECT query along with the $args array.</p> <p>The list of arguments that $args can contain, which will overwrite the defaults:</p> <p>orderby - Default is 'name'. Can be name, count, term_group, slug or nothing (will use term_id), Passing a custom value other than these will cause it to order based on the custom value.</p> <p>order - Default is ASC. Can use DESC.</p> <p>hide_empty - Default is true. Will not return empty terms, which means terms whose count is 0 according to the given taxonomy.</p> <p>exclude - Default is an empty array. An array, comma- or space-delimited string of term ids to exclude from the return array. If 'include' is non-empty, 'exclude' is ignored.</p> <p>exclude_tree - Default is an empty array. An array, comma- or space-delimited string of term ids to exclude from the return array, along with all of their descendant terms according to the primary taxonomy. If 'include' is non-empty, 'exclude_tree' is ignored.</p> <p>include - Default is an empty array. An array, comma- or space-delimited string of term ids to include in the return array.</p> <p>number - The maximum number of terms to return. Default is to return them all.</p> <p>offset - The number by which to offset the terms query.</p> <p>fields - Default is 'all', which returns an array of term objects. If 'fields' is 'ids' or 'names', returns an array of integers or strings, respectively.</p> <p>slug - Returns terms whose "slug" matches this value. Default is empty string.</p> <p>hierarchical - Whether to include terms that have non-empty descendants (even if 'hide_empty' is set to true).</p> <p>search - Returned terms' names will contain the value of 'search', case-insensitive. Default is an empty string.</p> <p>name__like - Returned terms' names will begin with the value of 'name__like', case-insensitive. Default is empty string.</p> <p>The argument 'pad_counts', if set to true will include the quantity of a term's children in the quantity of each term's "count" object variable.</p> <p>The 'get' argument, if set to 'all' instead of its default empty string, returns terms regardless of ancestry or whether the terms are empty.</p> <p>The 'child_of' argument, when used, should be set to the integer of a term ID. Its default is 0. If set to a non-zero value, all returned terms will be descendants of that term according to the given taxonomy. Hence 'child_of' is set to 0 if more than one taxonomy is passed in $taxonomies, because multiple taxonomies make term ancestry ambiguous.</p> <p>The 'parent' argument, when used, should be set to the integer of a term ID. Its default is the empty string '', which has a different meaning from the integer 0. If set to an integer value, all returned terms will have as an immediate ancestor the term whose ID is specified by that integer according to the given taxonomy. The 'parent' argument is different from 'child_of' in that a term X is considered a 'parent' of term Y only if term X is the father of term Y, not its grandfather or great-grandfather, etc.</p> <p>The 'cache_domain' argument enables a unique cache key to be produced when this query is stored in object cache. For instance, if you are using one of this function's filters to modify the query (such as 'terms_clauses'), setting 'cache_domain' to a unique value will not overwrite the cache for similar queries. Default value is 'core'.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_parse_args()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomies</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Taxonomy name or list of Taxonomy names</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>The values of what to search for when returning terms</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code><code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code>List of Term Objects and their children. Will return WP_Error, if any of $taxonomies do not exist.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_terms_to_edit"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_terms_to_edit" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_terms_to_edit .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>get_terms_to_edit(\unknown_type $post_id, $taxonomy) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$taxonomy</h4></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_ID"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_ID" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_ID .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the ID of the current item in the WordPress Loop.</h2> <pre>get_the_ID() : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$post</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>int</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_attachment_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_attachment_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_attachment_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve HTML content of attachment image with link.</h2> <pre>get_the_attachment_link(int $id, bool $fullsize, array $max_dims, bool $permalink) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use wp_get_attachment_link()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\wp_get_attachment_link()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$fullsize</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. Whether to use full size image.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$max_dims</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. Max image dimensions.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$permalink</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. Whether to include permalink to image.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_author"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_author" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_author .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the author of the current post.</h2> <pre>get_the_author(string $deprecated) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$authordata</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$deprecated</h4> <code>string</code><p>Deprecated.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The author's display name.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_author_ID"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_author_ID" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_author_ID .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the ID of the author of the current post.</h2> <pre>get_the_author_ID() : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row Content for when there is more text.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$stripteaser</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Strip teaser content before the more text. Default is false.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_content_feed"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_content_feed" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_content_feed .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the post content for feeds.</h2> <pre>get_the_content_feed(string $feed_type) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Feed.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Feed</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_the_content()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$feed_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of feed. rss2 | atom | rss | rdf</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_date"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_date" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_date .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the date the current $post was written.</h2> <pre>get_the_date(string $d) : string | null</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Unlike the_date() this function will always return the date. Modify output with 'get_the_date' filter.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$d</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional.
