Allows for a plugin to filter generators on an individual basis using the 'get_the_generator_{$type}' filter.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$type</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of generator to return - (html|xhtml|atom|rss2|rdf|comment|export).</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The HTML content for the generator.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_guid"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_guid" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_guid .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the Post Global Unique Identifier (guid).</h2> <pre>get_the_guid(int $id) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The guid will appear to be a link, but should not be used as an link to the post. The reason you should not use it as a link, is because of moving the blog across domains.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_modified_author"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_modified_author" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_modified_author .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the author who last edited the current post.</h2> <pre>get_the_modified_author() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$post</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_post_meta()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_userdata()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The author's display name.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_get_the_modified_date"></a><div class="element clickable function function_get_the_modified_date" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_get_the_modified_date .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the date on which the post was last modified.</h2> <pre>get_the_modified_date(string $d) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$d</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. PHP date format. Tags given as integers will only be checked against the post's tags' term_ids. If no tags are given, determines if post has any tags.</p> <p>Prior to v2.7 of WordPress, tags given as integers would also be checked against the post's tags' names and slugs (in addition to term_ids) Prior to v2.7, this function could only be used in the WordPress Loop. As of 2.7, the function can be used anywhere if it is provided a post ID or post object.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$tag</h4> <code>string</code><code>int</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. The tag name/term_id/slug or array of them to check for.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>Optional. Post to check instead of the current post. (since 2.7.0)</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>True if the current post has any of the given tags (or any tag, if no tag specified).</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_has_term"></a><div class="element clickable function function_has_term" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_has_term .collapse"> <h2>Check if the current post has any of given terms.</h2> <pre>has_term(string | int | array $term, string $taxonomy, int | object $post) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The given terms are checked against the post's terms' term_ids, names and slugs. </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_attachment_fields_to_edit"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_attachment_fields_to_edit" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_attachment_fields_to_edit .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>image_attachment_fields_to_edit(\unknown_type $form_fields, \unknown_type $post) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table id="function_image_attachment_fields_to_save"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_attachment_fields_to_save" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_attachment_fields_to_save .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>image_attachment_fields_to_save(\unknown_type $post, \unknown_type $attachment) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement id="function_image_constrain_size_for_editor"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_constrain_size_for_editor" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_constrain_size_for_editor .collapse"> <h2>Scale down the default size of an image.</h2> <pre>image_constrain_size_for_editor(int $width, int $height, string | array $size) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This is so that the image is a better fit for the editor and theme.</p> <p>The $size parameter accepts either an array or a string. The supported string values are 'thumb' or 'thumbnail' for the given thumbnail size or defaults at 128 width and 96 height in pixels. Also supported for the string value is 'medium' and 'full'. The 'full' isn't actually supported, but any value other than the supported will result in the content_width size or 500 if that is not set.</p> <p>Finally, there is a filter named 'editor_max_image_size', that will be called on the calculated array for width and height, respectively. The second parameter will be the value that was in the $size parameter. The returned type for the hook is an array with the width as the first element and the height as the second element.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_constrain_dimensions()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$width</h4> <code>int</code><p>Width of the image</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$height</h4> <code>int</code><p>Height of the image</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$size</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Size of what the result image should be.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Width and height of what the result image should resize to.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_downsize"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_downsize" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_downsize .collapse"> <h2>Scale an image to fit a particular size (such as 'thumb' or 'medium').</h2> <pre>image_downsize(int $id, array | string $size) : bool | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Array with image url, width, height, and whether is intermediate size, in that order is returned on success is returned. $is_intermediate is true if $url is a resized image, false if it is the original.</p> <p>The URL might be the original image, or it might be a resized version. This function won't create a new resized copy, it will just return an already resized one if it exists.</p> <p>A plugin may use the 'image_downsize' filter to hook into and offer image resizing services for images. The hook must return an array with the same elements that are returned in the function. The first element being the URL to the new image that was resized.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Attachment ID for image.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$size</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Optional, default is 'medium'. Size of image, either array or string.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>array</code>False on failure, array on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_edit_apply_changes"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_edit_apply_changes" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_edit_apply_changes .collapse"> <h2>image_edit_apply_changes() </h2> <pre>image_edit_apply_changes($img, $changes) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$img</h4></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$changes</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_get_intermediate_size"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_get_intermediate_size" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_get_intermediate_size .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the image's intermediate size (resized) path, width, and height.</h2> <pre>image_get_intermediate_size(int $post_id, array | string $size) : bool | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The $size parameter can be an array with the width and height respectively. If the size matches the 'sizes' metadata array for width and height, then it will be used. If there is no direct match, then the nearest image size larger than the specified size will be used. If nothing is found, then the function will break out and return false.</p> <p>The metadata 'sizes' is used for compatible sizes that can be used for the parameter $size value.</p> <p>The url path will be given, when the $size parameter is a string.</p> <p>If you are passing an array for the $size, you should consider using add_image_size() so that a cropped version is generated. It's much more efficient than having to find the closest-sized image and then having the browser scale down the image.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\add_image_size()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Attachment ID for image.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$size</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Optional, default is 'thumbnail'. Size of image, either array or string.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>array</code>False on failure or array of file path, width, and height on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_hwstring"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_hwstring" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_hwstring .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve width and height attributes using given width and height values.</h2> <pre>image_hwstring(int | string $width, int | string $height) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Both attributes are required in the sense that both parameters must have a value, but are optional in that if you set them to false or null, then they will not be added to the returned string.</p> <p>You can set the value using a string, but it will only take numeric values. If you wish to put 'px' after the numbers, then it will be stripped out of the return.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$width</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><p>Optional. Width attribute value.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$height</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><p>Optional. Height attribute value.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>HTML attributes for width and, or height.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_link_input_fields"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_link_input_fields" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_link_input_fields .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve HTML for the Link URL buttons with the default link type as specified.</h2> <pre>image_link_input_fields(\unknown_type $post, \unknown_type $url_type) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$url_type</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_make_intermediate_size"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_make_intermediate_size" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_make_intermediate_size .collapse"> <h2>Resize an image to make a thumbnail or intermediate size.</h2> <pre>image_make_intermediate_size(string $file, int $width, int $height, bool $crop) : bool | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The returned array has the file size, the image width, and image height. The filter 'image_make_intermediate_size' can be used to hook in and change the values of the returned array. The only parameter is the resized file path.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> <code>string</code><p>File path.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$width</h4> <code>int</code><p>Image width.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$height</h4> <code>int</code><p>Image height.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$crop</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. Whether to crop image to specified height and width or resize.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>array</code>False, if no image was created. Metadata array on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_media_send_to_editor"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_media_send_to_editor" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_media_send_to_editor .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>image_media_send_to_editor(\unknown_type $html, \unknown_type $attachment_id, \unknown_type $attachment) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$html</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attachment_id</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attachment</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_resize"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_resize" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_resize .collapse"> <h2>Scale down an image to fit a particular size and save a new copy of the image.</h2> <pre>image_resize(string $file, int $max_w, int $max_h, bool $crop, string $suffix, string $dest_path, int $jpeg_quality) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The PNG transparency will be preserved using the function, as well as the image type. If the file going in is PNG, then the resized image is going to be PNG. The only supported image types are PNG, GIF, and JPEG.</p> <p>Some functionality requires API to exist, so some PHP version may lose out support. This is not the fault of WordPress (where functionality is downgraded, not actual defects), but of your PHP version.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> <code>string</code><p>Image file path.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$max_w</h4> <code>int</code><p>Maximum width to resize to.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$max_h</h4> <code>int</code><p>Maximum height to resize to.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$crop</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. File suffix.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$dest_path</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. New image file path.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$jpeg_quality</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional, default is 90. Image quality percentage.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>WP_Error on failure. String with new destination path.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_image_resize_dimensions"></a><div class="element clickable function function_image_resize_dimensions" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_image_resize_dimensions .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve calculated resized dimensions for use in imagecopyresampled().</h2> <pre>image_resize_dimensions(int $orig_w, int $orig_h, int $dest_w, int $dest_h, bool $crop) : bool | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Calculate dimensions and coordinates for a resized image that fits within a specified width and height. If $crop is true, the largest matching central portion of the image will be cropped out and resized to the required size.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$orig_w</h4> <code>int</code><p>Original width.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$orig_h</h4> <code>int</code><p>Original height.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$dest_w</h4> <code>int</code><p>New width.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$dest_h</h4> <code>int</code><p>New height.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$crop</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. The filter is 'img_caption_shortcode' and passes an empty string, the attr parameter and the content parameter values.</p> <p>The supported attributes for the shortcode are 'id', 'align', 'width', and 'caption'.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attr</h4> <code>array</code><p>Attributes attributed to the shortcode.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$content</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Categories given as integers will only be checked against the post's categories' term_ids.</p> <p>Prior to v2.5 of WordPress, category names were not supported. Prior to v2.7, category slugs were not supported. Prior to v2.7, only one category could be compared: in_category( $single_category ). Prior to v2.7, this function could only be used in the WordPress Loop. As of 2.7, the function can be used anywhere if it is provided a post ID or post object.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$category</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Category ID, name or slug, or array of said.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>Optional. Post to check instead of the current post. (since 2.7.0)</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>True if the current post is in any of the given categories.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_in_the_loop"></a><div class="element clickable function function_in_the_loop" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_in_the_loop .collapse"> <h2>Whether the caller is in the Loop.</h2> <pre>in_the_loop() : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_query</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>True if caller is within loop, false if loop hasn't started or ended.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_includes_url"></a><div class="element clickable function function_includes_url" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_includes_url .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the url to the includes directory.</h2> <pre>includes_url(string $path) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$path</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> id="function_insert_blog"></a><div class="element clickable function function_insert_blog" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_insert_blog .collapse"> <h2>Store basic site info in the blogs table.</h2> <pre>insert_blog(string $domain, string $path, int $site_id) : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div It is the first step in creating a new blog.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$domain</h4> <code>string</code><p>The domain of the new site.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$path</h4> <code>string</code><p>The path of the new site.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$site_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Unless you're running a multi-network install, be sure to set this value to 1.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>int</code>The ID of the new row</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_insert_with_markers"></a><div class="element clickable function function_insert_with_markers" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_insert_with_markers .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>insert_with_markers(\unknown_type $filename, \unknown_type $marker, \unknown_type $insertion) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Inserts an array of strings into a file (.htaccess ), placing it between BEGIN and END markers. Replaces existing marked info. Retains surrounding data. Creates file if none exists.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$filename</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$marker</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$insertion</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>True on write success, false on failure.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_install_blog"></a><div class="element clickable function function_install_blog" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_install_blog .collapse"> <h2>Install an empty blog.</h2> <pre>install_blog(int $blog_id, string $blog_title) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Creates the new blog tables and options. If calling this function directly, be sure to use switch_to_blog() first, so that $wpdb points to the new blog.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr> id="function_is_active_sidebar"></a><div class="element clickable function function_is_active_sidebar" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_is_active_sidebar .collapse"> <h2>Whether a sidebar is in use.</h2> <pre>is_active_sidebar(mixed $index) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$index</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Sidebar name, id or number to check.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>true if the sidebar is in use, false otherwise.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_is_active_widget"></a><div class="element clickable function function_is_active_widget" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_is_active_widget .collapse"> <h2>Whether widget is displayed on the front-end.</h2> <pre>is_active_widget(string $callback, int $widget_id, string $id_base, bool $skip_inactive) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Either $callback or $id_base can be used $id_base is the first argument when extending WP_Widget class Without the optional $widget_id parameter, returns the ID of the first sidebar in which the first instance of the widget with the given callback or $id_base is found. With the $widget_id parameter, returns the ID of the sidebar where the widget with that callback/$id_base AND that ID is found.</p> <p>NOTE: $widget_id and $id_base are the same for single widgets. To be effective this function has to run after widgets have initialized, at action 'init' or later.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.2.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$callback</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, Widget callback to check.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$widget_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional, but needed for checking. Widget ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id_base</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, the base ID of a widget created by extending WP_Widget.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$skip_inactive</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, whether to check in 'wp_inactive_widgets'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>false if widget is not active or id of sidebar in which the widget is active.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_is_admin_bar_showing"></a><div class="element clickable function function_is_admin_bar_showing" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_is_admin_bar_showing .collapse"> <h2>Determine whether the admin bar should be showing.</h2> <pre>is_admin_bar_showing() : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>Whether the admin bar should be showing.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_is_allowed_http_origin"></a><div class="element clickable function function_is_allowed_http_origin" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_is_allowed_http_origin .collapse"> <h2>Determines if the http origin is an authorized one.</h2> <pre>is_allowed_http_origin(string $origin) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.4.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$origin</h4> <code>string</code><p>Origin URL. data-target=".function_is_object_in_term .collapse"> <h2>Determine if the given object is associated with any of the given terms.</h2> <pre>is_object_in_term(int $object_id, string $taxonomy, int | string | array $terms) : bool | \WP_Error.</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The given terms are checked against the object's terms' term_ids, names and slugs. Terms given as integers will only be checked against the object's terms' term_ids. If no terms are given, determines if object is associated with any terms in the given taxonomy.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_object_term_cache()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_get_object_terms()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$object_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>ID of the object (post ID, link ID, ...)</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Single taxonomy name</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$terms</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Term term_id, name, slug or array of said</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>\WP_Error.</code>WP_Error on input error.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_is_page"></a><div class="element clickable function function_is_page" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_is_page .collapse"> <h2>Is the query for a single page?</h2> <pre>is_page(mixed $page) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If the $page parameter is specified, this function will additionally check if the query is for one of the pages specified.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\is_single()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\is_singular()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Query::is_page()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_query</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$page</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Page ID, title, slug, or array of such.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>bool</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_is_page_template"></a><div class="element clickable function function_is_page_template" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_is_page_template .collapse"> <h2>Whether currently in a page template.</h2> <pre>is_page_template(string $template) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This template tag allows you to determine if you are in a page template. id="function_kses_init"></a><div class="element clickable function function_kses_init" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_kses_init .collapse"> <h2>Sets up most of the Kses filters for input form content.</h2> <pre>kses_init() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If you remove the kses_init() function from 'init' hook and 'set_current_user' (priority is default), then none of the Kses filter hooks will be added.</p> <p>First removes all of the Kses filters in case the current user does not need to have Kses filter the content. If the user does not have unfiltered_html capability, then Kses filters are added.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\kses_remove_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\kses_init_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> </table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_kses_init_filters"></a><div class="element clickable function function_kses_init_filters" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_kses_init_filters .collapse"> <h2>Adds all Kses input form content filters.</h2> <pre>kses_init_filters() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>All hooks have default priority. The wp_filter_kses() function is added to the 'pre_comment_content' and 'title_save_pre' hooks.</p> <p>The wp_filter_post_kses() function is added to the 'content_save_pre', 'excerpt_save_pre', and 'content_filtered_save_pre' hooks.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\add_filter()</td> </tr> </table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_kses_remove_filters"></a><div class="element clickable function function_kses_remove_filters" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_kses_remove_filters .collapse"> <h2>Removes all Kses input form content filters.</h2> <pre>kses_remove_filters() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>A quick procedural method to removing all of the filters that kses uses for content in WordPress Loop.</p> <p>Does not remove the kses_init() function from 'init' hook (priority is default). Also does not remove kses_init() function from 'set_current_user' hook (priority is also default).</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.6</td> </tr></table> to relative links in passed content.</h2> <pre>links_add_base_url(string $content, string $base, array $attrs) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>By default it supports the 'src' and 'href' attributes. However this can be changed via the 3rd param.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$content</h4> <code>string</code><p>String to search for links in.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$base</h4> <code>string</code><p>The base URL to prefix to links.</p></div> <div processed content.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_links_add_target"></a><div class="element clickable function function_links_add_target" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_links_add_target .collapse"> <h2>Adds a Target attribute to all links in passed content.</h2> <pre>links_add_target(string $content, string $target, array $tags) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function by default only applies to <a> tags, however this can be modified by the 3rd param.</p> <p><b>NOTE:</b> Any current target attributed will be stripped and replaced.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$content</h4> <code>string</code><p>String to search for links in.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$target</h4> <code>string</code><p>The Target to add to the links.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$tags</h4> <code>array</code><p>An array of tags to apply to.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The processed content.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_links_popup_script"></a><div class="element clickable function data-target=".function_mysql2date .collapse"> <h2>Converts given date string into a different format.</h2> <pre>mysql2date(string $format, string $date, bool $translate) : string | int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>$format should be either a PHP date format string, e.g. 'U' for a Unix timestamp, or 'G' for a Unix timestamp assuming that $date is GMT.</p> <p>If $translate is true then the given date and format string will be passed to date_i18n() for translation.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$format</h4> <code>string</code><p>Format of the date to return.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$date</h4> <code>string</code><p>Date string to convert.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$translate</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether the return date should be translated. Default is true.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code>int</code>Formatted date string, or Unix timestamp.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_network_admin_url"></a><div class="element clickable function function_network_admin_url" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_network_admin_url .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the url to the admin area for the network.</h2> <pre>network_admin_url(string $path, string $scheme) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$path</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional path relative to the admin url.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$scheme</h4> <code>string</code><p>The scheme to use. Default is 'admin', which obeys force_ssl_admin() and is_ssl(). 'http' or 'https' can be passed to force those schemes.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Admin url link with optional path appended.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_network_domain_check"></a><div class="element clickable function function_network_domain_check" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_network_domain_check .collapse"> <h2>Check for an existing network.</h2> <pre>network_domain_check() : \Whether</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>\Whether</code>a network exists.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_network_home_url"></a><div class="element clickable function function_network_home_url" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_network_home_url .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the home url for the current network.</h2> <pre>network_home_url(string $path, string $scheme) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Returns the home url with the appropriate protocol, 'https' if is_ssl() and 'http' otherwise. If $scheme is 'http' or 'https', is_ssl() is overridden.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$path</h4> <code>string</code><p>(optional) Path relative to the home url.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$scheme</h4> <code>string</code><p>(optional) Scheme to give the home url context. Currently 'http', 'https', or 'relative'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Home url link with optional path appended.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_network_site_url"></a><div class="element clickable function function_network_site_url" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_network_site_url .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the site url for the current network.</h2> <pre>network_site_url(string $path, string $scheme) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Returns the site url with the appropriate protocol, 'https' if is_ssl() and 'http' otherwise. Currently 'http', 'https', 'login', 'login_post', 'admin', or 'relative'.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Site url link with optional path appended.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_network_step1"></a><div class="element clickable function function_network_step1" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_network_step1 .collapse"> <h2>Prints step 1 for Network installation process.</h2> <pre>network_step1($errors) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>todo</th> <td>Realistically, step 1 should be a welcome screen explaining what a Network is and such. <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>page_template_dropdown(\unknown_type $default) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$default</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_paginate_comments_links"></a><div class="element clickable function function_paginate_comments_links" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_paginate_comments_links .collapse"> <h2>Create pagination links for the comments on the current post.</h2> <pre>paginate_comments_links(string | array $args) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\paginate_links()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional args. See paginate_links().</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Markup for pagination links.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_paginate_links"></a><div class="element clickable function function_paginate_links" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_paginate_links .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve paginated link for archive post pages.</h2> <pre>paginate_links(string | array $args) : array | string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Technically, the function can be used to create paginated link list for any area. The 'base' argument is used to reference the url, which will be used to create the paginated links. The 'format' argument is then used for replacing the page number. It is however, most likely and by default, to be used on the archive post pages.</p> <p>The 'type' argument controls format of the returned value. The default is 'plain', which is just a string with the links separated by a newline character. The other possible values are either 'array' or 'list'. The 'array' value will return an array of the paginated link list to offer full control of display. The 'list' value will place all of the paginated links in an unordered HTML list.</p> <p>The 'total' argument is the total amount of pages and is an integer. The 'current' argument is the current page number and is also an integer.</p> <p>An example of the 'base' argument is "http://example.com/all_posts.php%<em>%" and the '%</em>%' is required. The '%_%' will be replaced by the contents of in the 'format' argument. An example for the 'format' argument is "?page=%#%" and the '%#%' is also required. The '%#%' will be replaced with the page number.</p> <p>You can include the previous and next links in the list by setting the 'prev_next' argument to true, which it is by default. You can set the previous text, by using the 'prev_text' argument. You can set the next text by setting the 'next_text' argument.</p> <p>If the 'show_all' argument is set to true, then it will show all of the pages instead of a short list of the pages near the current page. By default, the 'show_all' is set to false and controlled by the 'end_size' and 'mid_size' arguments. The 'end_size' argument is how many numbers on either the start and the end list edges, by default is 1. The 'mid_size' argument is how many numbers to either side of current page, but not including current page.</p> <p>It is possible to add query vars to the link by using the 'add_args' argument and see <a href="add_query_arg()">add_query_arg()</a> for more information.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Override defaults.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code><code>string</code>String of page links or array of page links.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_parent_dropdown"></a><div class="element clickable function function_parent_dropdown" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_parent_dropdown .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>parent_dropdown(\unknown_type $default, \unknown_type $parent, \unknown_type $level) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$default</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$parent</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$level</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_parent_post_rel_link"></a><div class="element class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$deprecated</h4> <code>string</code> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_pingback"></a><div class="element clickable function function_pingback" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_pingback .collapse"> <h2>Pings back the links found in a post.</h2> <pre>pingback(string $content, int $post_ID) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> id="function_pings_open"></a><div class="element clickable function function_pings_open" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_pings_open .collapse"> <h2>Whether the current post is open for pings.</h2> <pre>pings_open(int $post_id) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$post</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>An optional post ID to check instead of the current post.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>True if pings are accepted</div> </div></div> <pre>plugin_sandbox_scrape($plugin) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$plugin</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_plugins_api"></a><div class="element clickable function function_plugins_api" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_plugins_api .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve plugin installer pages from WordPress Plugins API.</h2> <pre>plugins_api(string $action, array | object $args) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>It is possible for a plugin to override the Plugin API result with three filters. Assume this is for plugins, which can extend on the Plugin Info to offer more choices. This is very powerful and must be used with care, when overriding the filters.</p> <p>The first filter, 'plugins_api_args', is for the args and gives the action as the second parameter. The hook for 'plugins_api_args' must ensure that an object is returned.</p> <p>The second filter, 'plugins_api', is the result that would be returned.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$action</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><code>object</code><p>Optional. Arguments to serialize for the Plugin Info API.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>plugins_api response object on success, WP_Error on failure.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_plugins_url"></a><div class="element clickable function function_plugins_url" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_plugins_url .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the url to the plugins directory or to a specific file within that directory.</h2> <pre>plugins_url(string $path, string $plugin) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>You can hardcode the plugin slug in $path or pass <strong>FILE</strong> as a second argument to get the correct folder name.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$path</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Path relative to the plugins url.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$plugin</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. The plugin file that you want to be relative to - i.e. pass in <strong>FILE</strong></p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Plugins url link with optional path appended.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_populate_network"></a><div class="element clickable function function_populate_network" data-toggle="collapse" <pre>post_password_required(int | object $post) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>An optional class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_prep_atom_text_construct"></a><div class="element clickable function function_prep_atom_text_construct" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_prep_atom_text_construct .collapse"> <h2>Determine the type of a string of data with the data formatted.</h2> <pre>prep_atom_text_construct(string $data) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Tell whether the type is text, html, or xhtml, per RFC 4287 section 3.1.</p> <p>In the case of WordPress, text is defined as containing no markup, xhtml is defined as "well formed", and html as tag soup (i.e., the rest).</p> <p>Container div tags are added to xhtml values, per section 3.1.1.3.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://www.atomenabled.org/developers/syndication/atom-format-spec.php#rfc.section.3.1">http://www.atomenabled.org/developers/syndication/atom-format-spec.php#rfc.section.3.1</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Feed.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Feed</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$data</h4> <code>string</code><p>Input string</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>array(type, value)</div> </div></div> <pre>recurse_dirsize(string $directory) : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Used by get_dirsize() to get a directory's size when it contains other directories.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$directory</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>int</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_redirect_canonical"></a><div class="element clickable function function_redirect_canonical" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_redirect_canonical .collapse"> <h2>Redirects incoming links to the proper URL based on the site url.</h2> <pre>redirect_canonical(string $requested_url, bool $do_redirect) : null | false | string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Search engines consider www.somedomain.com and somedomain.com to be two different URLs when they both go to the same location. This SEO enhancement prevents penalty for duplicate content by redirecting all incoming links to one or the other.</p> <p>Prevents redirection for feeds, trackbacks, searches, comment popup, and admin URLs. Does not redirect on IIS, page/post previews, and on form data.</p> <p>Will also attempt to find the correct link when a user enters a URL that does not exist based on exact WordPress query. Will instead try to parse the URL or query in an attempt to figure the correct page to go to.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_rewrite</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$is_IIS</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$requested_url</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. The URL that was requested, used to figure if redirect is needed.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$do_redirect</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Redirect to the new URL.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>null</code><code>false</code><code>string</code>Null, if redirect not needed. False, if redirect not needed or the string of the URL</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_redirect_guess_404_permalink"></a><div class="element clickable function function_redirect_guess_404_permalink" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_redirect_guess_404_permalink .collapse"> <h2>Attempts to guess the correct URL based on query vars</h2> <pre>redirect_guess_404_permalink() : bool | string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>string</code>The correct URL if one is found. False on failure.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_redirect_old_akismet_urls"></a><div class="element clickable function function_redirect_old_akismet_urls" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_redirect_old_akismet_urls .collapse"> <h2>redirect_old_akismet_urls() </h2> <pre>redirect_old_akismet_urls() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_redirect_post"></a><div class="element clickable function function_redirect_post" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_redirect_post .collapse"> <h2>Redirect to previous page.</h2> <pre>redirect_post(int $post_id) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. </div></div> </div> <a id="function_register_activation_hook"></a><div class="element clickable function function_register_activation_hook" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_register_activation_hook .collapse"> <h2>Set the activation hook for a plugin.</h2> <pre>register_activation_hook(string $file, callback $function) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>When a plugin is activated, the action 'activate_PLUGINNAME' hook is activated. In the name of this hook, PLUGINNAME is replaced with the name of the plugin, including the optional subdirectory. For example, when the plugin is located in wp-content/plugin/sampleplugin/sample.php, then the name of this hook will become 'activate_sampleplugin/sample.php'. When the plugin consists of only one file and is (as by default) located at wp-content/plugin/sample.php the name of this hook will be 'activate_sample.php'.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Plugin.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Plugin</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> <code>string</code><p>The filename of the plugin including the path.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$function</h4> <code>callback</code><p>the function hooked to the 'activate_PLUGIN' action.</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_register_admin_color_schemes"></a><div class="element clickable function function_register_admin_color_schemes" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_register_admin_color_schemes .collapse"> <h2>Registers the default Admin color schemes</h2> <pre>register_admin_color_schemes() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_register_column_headers"></a><div class="element clickable function function_register_column_headers" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_register_column_headers .collapse"> <h2>Register column headers for a particular screen.</h2> <pre>register_column_headers(string $screen, array $columns) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_column_headers(),</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$screen</h4> <code>string</code><p>The handle for the screen to add help to. This is usually the hook name returned by the add_*_page() functions.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$columns</h4> <code>array</code><p>An array of columns with column IDs as the keys and translated column names as the values</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_register_deactivation_hook"></a><div class="element clickable function function_register_deactivation_hook" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_register_deactivation_hook .collapse"> <h2>Set the deactivation hook for a plugin.</h2> <pre>register_deactivation_hook(string $file, callback $function) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>When a plugin is deactivated, the action 'deactivate_PLUGINNAME' hook is deactivated. In the name of this hook, PLUGINNAME is replaced with the name of the plugin, including the optional subdirectory. For example, when the plugin is located in wp-content/plugin/sampleplugin/sample.php, then the name of this hook will become 'activate_sampleplugin/sample.php'.</p> <p>When the plugin consists of only one file and is (as by default) located at wp-content/plugin/sample.php the name of this hook will be 'activate_sample.php'.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Plugin.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Plugin</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> <code>string</code><p>The filename of the plugin including the path.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$function</h4> <code>callback</code><p>the function hooked to the 'activate_PLUGIN' action.</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_register_default_headers"></a><div class="element clickable function function_register_default_headers" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_register_default_headers .collapse"> <h2>Register a selection of default headers to be displayed by the custom header admin UI.</h2> <pre>register_default_headers(array $headers) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$headers</h4> <code>array</code><p>Array of headers keyed by a string id. The ids point to arrays containing 'url', 'thumbnail_url', and 'description' keys.</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_register_importer"></a><div class="element clickable function function_register_importer" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_register_importer .collapse"> <h2>Register importer for WordPress.</h2> <pre>register_importer(string $id, string $name, string $description, callback $callback) : <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>string</code><p>Importer tag. A function or method to call when performing edit_post_meta, add_post_meta, and delete_post_meta capability checks.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_register_nav_menu"></a><div class="element clickable function function_register_nav_menu" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_register_nav_menu .collapse"> <h2>Register a navigation menu for a theme.</h2> <pre>register_nav_menu(string $location, string $description) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$location</h4> <code>string</code><p>Menu location identifier, class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$locations</h4>
