class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Query::the_comment()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_query</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>object</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_content"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_content" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_content .collapse"> <h2>Display the post content.</h2> <pre>the_content(string $more_link_text, bool $stripteaser) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$more_link_text</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Content for when there is more text.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$stripteaser</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Strip teaser content before the more text. Default is false.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_content_feed"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_content_feed" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_content_feed .collapse"> <h2>Display the post content for feeds.</h2> <pre>the_content_feed(string $feed_type) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Feed.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Feed</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_the_content()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$feed_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of feed. rss2 | atom | rss | rdf</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_content_rss"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_content_rss" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_content_rss .collapse"> <h2>Display the post content for the feed.</h2> <pre>the_content_rss(string $more_link_text, int | bool $stripteaser, string $more_file, int $cut, int $encode_html) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>For encoding the html or the $encode_html parameter, there are three possible values. '0' will make urls footnotes and use make_url_footnote(). '1' will encode special characters and automatically display all of the content. The value of '2' will strip all HTML tags from the content.</p> <p>Also note that you cannot set the amount of words and not set the html encoding. If that is the case, then the html encoding will default to 2, which will strip all HTML tags.</p> <p>To restrict the amount of words of the content, you can use the cut parameter. If the content is less than the amount, then there won't be any dots added to the end. If there is content left over, then dots will be added and the rest of the content will be removed.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Feed.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Feed</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\get_the_content()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use the_content_feed()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\the_content_feed()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$more_link_text</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Text to display when more content is available but not displayed.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$stripteaser</h4> <code>int</code><code>bool</code><p>Optional. Default is 0.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$more_file</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$cut</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Amount of words to keep for the content.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$encode_html</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. How to encode the content.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_date"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_date" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_date .collapse"> <h2>Display or Retrieve the date the current $post was written (once per date)</h2> <pre>the_date(string $d, string $before, string $after, bool $echo) : string | null</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Will only output the date if the current post's date is different from the previous one output.</p> <p>i.e. Only one date listing will show per day worth of posts shown in the loop, even if the function is called several times for each post.</p> <p>HTML output can be filtered with 'the_date'. Date string output can be filtered with 'get_the_date'.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_the_date()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$d</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. PHP date format defaults to the date_format option if not specified.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$before</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Output before the date.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$after</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Output after the date.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$echo</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is display. Whether to echo the date or return it.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code>null</code>Null if displaying, string if retrieving.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_date_xml"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_date_xml" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_date_xml .collapse"> <h2>Outputs the date in iso8601 format for xml files.</h2> <pre>the_date_xml() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_editor"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_editor" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_editor .collapse"> <h2>Display editor: TinyMCE, HTML, or both.</h2> <pre>the_editor(string $content, string $id, string $prev_id, bool $media_buttons, int $tab_index, $extended) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>3.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use wp_editor()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\wp_editor()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$content</h4> <code>string</code><p>Textarea content.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is 'content'. Thumbnail.</h2> <pre>the_post_thumbnail(int $size, string | array $attr) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$size</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Image size. Defaults to 'post-thumbnail', which theme sets using set_post_thumbnail_size( $width, $height, $crop_flag );.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attr</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Query string or array of attributes.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_search_query"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_search_query" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_search_query .collapse"> <h2>Display the contents of the search query variable.</h2> <pre>the_search_query() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The search query string is passed through <a href="esc_attr()">esc_attr()</a> to ensure that it is safe for placing in an html attribute.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\esc_attr()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> </table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_shortlink"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_shortlink" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_shortlink .collapse"> <h2>Display the Short Link for a Post</h2> <pre>the_shortlink(string $text, string $title, string $before, string $after) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Must be called from inside "The Loop"</p> <p>Call like the_shortlink(__('Shortlinkage FTW'))</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$text</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional The link text or HTML to be displayed. Defaults to 'This is the short link.'</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$title</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional The tooltip for the link. Must be sanitized. Defaults to the sanitized post title.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$before</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional HTML to display before the link.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$after</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional HTML to display after the link.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_tags"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_tags" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_tags .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve the tags for a post.</h2> <pre>the_tags(string $before, string $sep, string $after) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$before</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. You can also use it outside the Loop to display the taxonomies for a specific post.</p> <p>The available defaults are: 'post' : default is 0. The post ID to get taxonomies of. 'before' : default is empty string. Display before taxonomies list. 'sep' : default is empty string. Separate every taxonomy with value in this. 'after' : default is empty string. Display this after the taxonomies list. 'template' : The template to use for displaying the taxonomy terms.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_the_taxonomies()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><p>Override the defaults.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_the_terms"></a><div class="element clickable function function_the_terms" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_the_terms .collapse"> <h2>Display the terms in a list.</h2> <pre>the_terms(int $id, string $taxonomy, string $before, string $sep, string $after) : null | bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy name.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$before</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_themes_api .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve theme installer pages from WordPress Themes API.</h2> <pre>themes_api(string $action, array | object $args) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>It is possible for a theme to override the Themes API result with three filters. Assume this is for themes, which can extend on the Theme Info to offer more choices. This is very powerful and must be used with care, when overridding the filters.</p> <p>The first filter, 'themes_api_args', is for the args and gives the action as the second parameter. The hook for 'themes_api_args' must ensure that an object is returned.</p> <p>The second filter, 'themes_api', is the result that would be returned.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$action</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><code>object</code><p>Optional. It is not restricted to paths and offers no specific path support.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <h2>Translate the result of _n_noop() or _nx_noop()</h2> <pre>translate_nooped_plural(array $nooped_plural, int $count, string $domain) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$nooped_plural</h4> <code>array</code><p>Array with singular, plural and context keys, usually the result of _n_noop() or _nx_noop()</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$count</h4> <code>int</code><p>Number of objects</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$domain</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. The domain identifier the text should be retrieved in. If $nooped_plural contains a domain passed to _n_noop() or _nx_noop(), it will override this value.</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_translate_smiley"></a><div class="element clickable function function_translate_smiley" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_translate_smiley .collapse"> <h2>Convert one smiley code to the icon graphic file equivalent.</h2> <pre>translate_smiley(string $smiley) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Looks up one smiley code in the $wpsmiliestrans global array and returns an <img> string for that smiley.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>global</th> <td>array $wpsmiliestrans</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$smiley</h4> <code>string</code><p>Smiley code to convert to image.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Image string for smiley.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_translate_user_role"></a><div class="element clickable function function_translate_user_role" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_translate_user_role .collapse"> <h2>Translates role name.</h2> <pre>translate_user_role($name) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Since the role names are in the database and not in the source there are dummy gettext calls to get them into the POT file and this function properly translates them back.</p> <p>The before_last_bar() call is needed, because older installs keep the roles using the old context format: 'Role name|User role' and just skipping the content after the last bar is easier than fixing them in the DB. New installs won't suffer from that problem.</p></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$name</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_translate_with_context"></a><div class="element clickable function function_translate_with_context" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_translate_with_context .collapse"> <h2>Translates $text like translate(), but assumes that the text contains a context after its last vertical bar.</h2> <pre>translate_with_context(string $text, string $domain) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\translate()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use _x()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\_x()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$text</h4> <code>string</code><p>Text to translate</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$domain</h4> <code>string</code><p>Domain to retrieve the translated text</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Translated text</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_translate_with_gettext_context"></a><div class="element </div></div> </div> <a id="function_twentyeleven_setup"></a><div class="element clickable function function_twentyeleven_setup" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_twentyeleven_setup .collapse"> <h2>Sets up theme defaults and registers support for various WordPress features.</h2> <pre>twentyeleven_setup() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Note that this function is hooked into the after_setup_theme hook, which runs before the init hook. The init hook is too late for some features, such as indicating support post thumbnails.</p> <p>To override twentyeleven_setup() in a child theme, add your own twentyeleven_setup to your child theme's functions.php file.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\load_theme_textdomain()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\add_editor_style()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\add_theme_support()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\register_nav_menus()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\register_default_headers()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\set_post_thumbnail_size()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>Twenty Eleven 1.0</td> </tr> </table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_twentyeleven_theme_options_add_page"></a><div class="element clickable function function_twentyeleven_theme_options_add_page" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_twentyeleven_theme_options_add_page .collapse"> <h2>Add our theme options page to the admin menu, including some help documentation.</h2> <pre>twentyeleven_theme_options_add_page() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function is attached to the admin_menu action hook.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>Twenty Eleven 1.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_twentyeleven_theme_options_help"></a><div class="element clickable function function_twentyeleven_theme_options_help" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_twentyeleven_theme_options_help .collapse"> <h2>twentyeleven_theme_options_help() </h2> <pre>twentyeleven_theme_options_help() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_twentyeleven_theme_options_init"></a><div class="element clickable function function_twentyeleven_theme_options_init" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_twentyeleven_theme_options_init .collapse"> <h2>Register the form setting for our twentyeleven_options array.</h2> <pre>twentyeleven_theme_options_init() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function is attached to the admin_init action hook.</p> <p>This call to register_setting() registers a validation callback, twentyeleven_theme_options_validate(), which is used when the option is saved, to ensure that our option values are complete, properly formatted, and safe.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>Twenty Eleven 1.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_twentyeleven_theme_options_render_page"></a><div class="element clickable function function_twentyeleven_theme_options_render_page" data-toggle="collapse" Using Twenty Ten 1.2 in WordPress 3.0 will show the styles, but they won't have any effect on the widget in default Twenty Ten styling.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>Twenty Ten 1.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_twentyten_setup"></a><div class="element clickable function function_twentyten_setup" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_twentyten_setup .collapse"> <h2>Sets up theme defaults and registers support for various WordPress features.</h2> <pre>twentyten_setup() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Note that this function is hooked into the after_setup_theme hook, which runs before the init hook. The init hook is too late for some features, such as indicating support post thumbnails.</p> <p>To override twentyten_setup() in a child theme, add your own twentyten_setup to your child theme's functions.php file.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\add_theme_support()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\register_nav_menus()</td> </tr> <tr> id="function_untrailingslashit"></a><div class="element clickable function function_untrailingslashit" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_untrailingslashit .collapse"> <h2>Removes trailing slash if it exists.</h2> <pre>untrailingslashit(string $string) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The primary use of this is for paths and thus should be used for paths. It is not restricted to paths and offers no specific path support.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.2.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$string</h4> <code>string</code><p>What to remove the trailing slash from.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>String without the trailing slash.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_unzip_file"></a><div class="element clickable function function_unzip_file" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_unzip_file .collapse"> <h2>Unzips a specified ZIP file to a location on the Filesystem via the WordPress Filesystem Abstraction.</h2> <pre>unzip_file(string $file, string $to) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Assumes that WP_Filesystem() has already been called and set up. Does not extract a root-level __MACOSX directory, if present.</p> <p>Attempts to increase the PHP Memory limit to 256M before uncompressing, However, The most memory required shouldn't be much larger than the Archive itself.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> It might be a legacy function left over from when there was a need for updating the category cache.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>Always return True</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_comment_cache"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_comment_cache" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_comment_cache .collapse"> <h2>Updates the comment cache of given comments.</h2> <pre>update_comment_cache(array $comments) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Will add the comments in $comments to the cache. If comment ID already exists in the comment cache then it will not be updated. The comment is added to the cache using the comment group with the key using the ID of the comments.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Cache.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Cache</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$comments</h4> <code>array</code><p>Array of comment row objects</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_comment_meta"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_comment_meta" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_comment_meta .collapse"> <h2>Update comment meta field based on comment ID.</h2> <pre>update_comment_meta(int $comment_id, string $meta_key, mixed $meta_value, mixed $prev_value) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Use the $prev_value parameter to differentiate between meta fields with the same key and comment ID.</p> <p>If the meta field for the comment does not exist, it will be added.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\update_metadata</td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/update_comment_meta">http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/update_comment_meta</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$comment_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Comment ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$meta_key</h4> <code>string</code><p>Metadata key.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$meta_value</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Metadata value.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$prev_value</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Optional. Previous value to check before removing.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>False on failure, true if success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_core"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_core" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_core .collapse"> <h2>Upgrade the core of WordPress.</h2> <pre>update_core(string $from, string $to) : <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a> | null</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This will create a .maintenance file at the base of the WordPress directory to ensure that people can not access the web site, when the files are being copied to their locations.</p> <p>The files in the <a href="$_old_files">$_old_files</a> list will be removed and the new files copied from the zip file after the database is upgraded.</p> <p>The files in the <a href="$_new_bundled_files">$_new_bundled_files</a> list will be added to the installation if the version is greater than or equal to the old version being upgraded.</p> <p>The steps for the upgrader for after the new release is downloaded and unzipped is: 1. Test unzipped location for select files to ensure that unzipped worked. 2. Create the .maintenance file in current WordPress base. 3. Copy new WordPress directory over old WordPress files. 4. Upgrade WordPress to new version. 4.1. Copy all files/folders other than wp-content 4.2. Copy any language files to WP_LANG_DIR (which may differ from WP_CONTENT_DIR 4.3. Copy any new bundled themes/plugins to their respective locations 5. Delete new WordPress directory path. 6. Delete .maintenance file. 7. Remove old files. 8. Delete 'update_core' option.</p> <p>There are several areas of failure. For instance if PHP times out before step 6, then you will not be able to access any portion of your site. Also, since the upgrade will not continue where it left off, you will not be able to automatically remove old files and remove the 'update_core' option. This isn't that bad.</p> <p>If the copy of the new WordPress over the old fails, then the worse is that the new WordPress directory will remain.</p> <p>If it is assumed that every file will be copied over, including plugins and themes, then if you edit the default theme, you should rename it, so that your changes remain.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.7.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$from</h4> <code>string</code><p>New release unzipped path.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$to</h4> <code>string</code><p>Path to old WordPress installation.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code><code>null</code>WP_Error on failure, null on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_gallery_tab"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_gallery_tab" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_gallery_tab .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_home_siteurl"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_home_siteurl" </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_meta"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_meta" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_meta .collapse"> class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_object_term_cache"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_object_term_cache" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_object_term_cache .collapse"> <h2>Updates the cache for Term ID(s).</h2> <pre>update_object_term_cache(string | array $object_ids, array | string $object_type) : null | bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Will only update the cache for terms not already cached.</p> <p>The $object_ids expects that the ids be separated by commas, if it is a string.</p> <p>It should be noted that update_object_term_cache() is very time extensive. It is advised that the function is not called very often or at least not for a lot of terms that exist in a lot of taxonomies. The amount of time increases for each term and it also increases for each taxonomy the term belongs to.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_get_object_terms()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$object_ids</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Single or list of term object ID(s)</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$object_type</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>The taxonomy object type</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>null</code><code>bool</code>Null value is given with empty $object_ids. False if</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_option"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_option" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_option .collapse"> <h2>Update the value of an option that was already added.</h2> <pre>update_option(string $option, mixed $newvalue) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>You do not need to serialize values. If the value needs to be serialized, then it will be serialized before it is inserted into the database. Remember, resources can not be serialized or added as an option.</p> <p>If the option does not exist, then the option will be added with the option value, but you will not be able to set whether it is autoloaded. If you want to set whether an option is autoloaded, then you need to use the add_option().</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Option.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Option</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$option</h4> <code>string</code><p>Option name. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$newvalue</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Option value. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>False if value was not updated and true if value was updated.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_option_new_admin_email"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_option_new_admin_email" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_option_new_admin_email .collapse"> <h2>update_option_new_admin_email() </h2> <pre>update_option_new_admin_email($old_value, $value) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$old_value</h4></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$value</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_page_cache"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_page_cache" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_page_cache .collapse"> <h2>Alias of update_post_cache().</h2> <pre>update_page_cache(array $pages) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\update_post_cache()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> .collapse"> <h2>Call major cache updating functions for list of Post objects.</h2> <pre>update_post_caches(array $posts, string $post_type, bool $update_term_cache, bool $update_meta_cache) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Cache.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Cache</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\update_post_cache()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\update_object_term_cache()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\update_postmeta_cache()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$posts</h4> <code>array</code><p>Array of Post objects</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>The post type of the posts in $posts. Default is 'post'.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$update_term_cache</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to update the term cache. Default is true.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$update_meta_cache</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to update the meta cache. Default is true.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_post_meta"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_post_meta" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_post_meta .collapse"> <h2>Update post meta field based on post ID.</h2> <pre>update_post_meta(int $post_id, string $meta_key, mixed $meta_value, mixed $prev_value) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Use the $prev_value parameter to differentiate between meta fields with the same key and post ID.</p> <p>If the meta field for the post does not exist, it will be added.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/update_post_meta">http://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/update_post_meta</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$meta_key</h4> <code>string</code><p>Metadata key.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$meta_value</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Metadata value.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$prev_value</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Optional. Previous value to check before removing.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>False on failure, true if success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_post_thumbnail_cache"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_post_thumbnail_cache" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_post_thumbnail_cache .collapse"> <h2>Update cache for thumbnails in the current loop</h2> <pre>update_post_thumbnail_cache(object $wp_query) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.2</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$wp_query</h4> <code>object</code><p>Optional. A WP_Query instance. Defaults to the $wp_query global.</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_postmeta_cache"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_postmeta_cache" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_postmeta_cache .collapse"> <h2>Updates metadata cache for list of post IDs.</h2> <pre>update_postmeta_cache(array $post_ids) : bool | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Performs SQL query to retrieve the metadata for the post IDs and updates the metadata cache for the posts. Therefore, the functions, which call this function, do not need to perform SQL queries on their own.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Cache.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Cache</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_ids</h4> <code>array</code><p>List of post IDs.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>array</code>Returns false if there is nothing to update or an array of metadata.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_posts_count"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_posts_count" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_posts_count .collapse"> <h2>Update a blog's post count.</h2> <pre>update_posts_count($deprecated) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>WordPress MS stores a blog's post count as an option so as to avoid extraneous COUNTs when a blog's details are fetched with get_blog_details(). This function is called when posts are published to make sure the count stays current.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>MU</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> If the 'global' parameter is false, which it is by default it will prepend the WordPress table prefix to the option name.</p> <p>Deletes the user option if $newvalue is empty.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$user_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>User ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$option_name</h4> <code>string</code><p>User option name.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$newvalue</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>User option value.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$global</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Whether option name is global or blog specific. Default false (blog specific).</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_user_status"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_user_status" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_user_status .collapse"> <h2>update_user_status() </h2> <pre>update_user_status($id, $pref, $value, $deprecated) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$id</h4></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$pref</h4></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$value</h4></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$deprecated</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_update_usermeta"></a><div class="element clickable function function_update_usermeta" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_update_usermeta .collapse"> <h2>Update metadata of user.</h2> <pre>update_usermeta(int $user_id, string $meta_key, mixed $meta_value) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>There is no need to serialize values, they will be serialized if it is needed. The metadata key can only be a string with underscores. All else will be removed.</p> <p>Will remove the metadata, if the meta value is empty.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> failure.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_upgrade_100"></a><div class="element clickable function function_upgrade_100" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_upgrade_100 .collapse"> id="function_user_pass_ok"></a><div class="element clickable function function_user_pass_ok" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_user_pass_ok .collapse"> <h2>Check that the user login name and password is correct.</h2> <pre>user_pass_ok(string $user_login, string $user_pass) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>todo</th> <td>xmlrpc only. Maybe move to xmlrpc.php.</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$user_login</h4> <code>string</code><p>User name.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$user_pass</h4> <code>string</code><p>User password.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>False if does not authenticate, true if username and password authenticates.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_user_trailingslashit"></a><div class="element clickable function function_user_trailingslashit" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_user_trailingslashit .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve trailing slash string, if blog set for adding trailing slashes.</h2> <pre>user_trailingslashit(string $string, string $type_of_url) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Conditionally adds a trailing slash if the permalink structure has a trailing slash, strips the trailing slash if not. The string is passed through the 'user_trailingslashit' filter. Will remove trailing slash from string, if blog is not set to have them.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> A return value of '3' means that the file is not in the allowed files list.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div stylesheet has already been added. Accepts a string $data containing the CSS. data-target=".function_wp_admin_bar_new_content_menu .collapse"> <h2>Add "Add New" menu.</h2> <pre>wp_admin_bar_new_content_menu($wp_admin_bar) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$wp_admin_bar</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_admin_bar_render"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_admin_bar_render" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_admin_bar_render .collapse"> <h2>Render the admin bar to the page based on the $wp_admin_bar->menu member var.</h2> <pre>wp_admin_bar_render() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This is called very late on the footer actions so that it will render after anything else being added to the footer.</p> <p>It includes the action "admin_bar_menu" which should be used to hook in and add new menus to the admin bar. That way you can be sure that you are adding at most optimal point, right before the admin bar is rendered. This also gives you access to the $post global, among others.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_admin_bar_search_menu"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_admin_bar_search_menu" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_admin_bar_search_menu .collapse"> id="function_wp_admin_bar_wp_menu"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_admin_bar_wp_menu" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_admin_bar_wp_menu .collapse"> <h2>Add the WordPress logo menu.</h2> <pre>wp_admin_bar_wp_menu($wp_admin_bar) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.3.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$wp_admin_bar</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_admin_css"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_admin_css" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_admin_css .collapse"> <h2>Enqueues or directly prints a stylesheet link to the specified CSS file.</h2> <pre>wp_admin_css(string $file, bool $force_echo) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>"Intelligently" decides to enqueue or to print the CSS file. If the 'wp_print_styles' action has <em>not</em> yet been called, the CSS file will be enqueued. If the wp_print_styles action <em>has</em> been called, the CSS link will be printed. Printing may be forced by passing true as the $force_echo (second) parameter.</p> <p>For backward compatibility with WordPress 2.3 calling method: If the $file (first) parameter does not correspond to a registered CSS file, we assume $file is a file relative to wp-admin/ without its ".css" extension. A stylesheet link to that generated URL is printed.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_styles</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Style handle name or file name (without ".css" extension) relative to wp-admin/. Defaults to 'wp-admin'.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$force_echo</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Force the stylesheet link to be printed rather than enqueued.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_admin_css_color"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_admin_css_color" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_admin_css_color .collapse"> <h2>Registers an admin colour scheme css file.</h2> <pre>wp_admin_css_color(string $key, string $name, string $url, array $colors) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Allows a plugin to register a new admin colour scheme. For example:</p> <pre><code>wp_admin_css_color('classic', __('Classic'), admin_url("css/colors-classic.css"), array('#07273E', '#14568A', '#D54E21', '#2683AE')); </code></pre></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$key</h4> <code>string</code><p>The unique key for this theme.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$name</h4> <code>string</code><p>The name of the theme.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$url</h4> <code>string</code><p>The url of the css file containing the colour scheme.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$colors</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional An array of CSS color definitions which are used to give the user a feel for the theme.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_admin_css_uri"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_admin_css_uri" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_admin_css_uri .collapse"> <h2>Display the URL of a WordPress admin CSS file.</h2> <pre>wp_admin_css_uri(string $file) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Styles::_css_href</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> <code>string</code><p>file relative to wp-admin/ without its ".css" extension.</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_ajax_add_link_category"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_ajax_add_link_category" data-toggle="collapse" comment contain blacklisted characters or words.</h2> <pre>wp_blacklist_check(string $author, string $email, string $url, string $comment, string $user_ip, string $user_agent) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> response"> <code>bool</code>True if comment contains blacklisted content, false if comment does not</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_add"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_add" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_add .collapse"> <h2>Adds data to the cache, if the cache key doesn't already exist.</h2> <pre>wp_cache_add(int | string $key, mixed $data, string $group, int $expire) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_object_cache</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Object_Cache::add()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$key</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><p>The cache key to use for retrieval later</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$data</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>The data to add to the cache store</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$group</h4> <code>string</code><p>The group to add the cache to</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$expire</h4> <code>int</code><p>When the cache data should be expired</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_add_global_groups"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_add_global_groups" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_add_global_groups .collapse"> <h2>Adds a group or set of groups to the list of global groups.</h2> <pre>wp_cache_add_global_groups(string | array $groups) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$groups</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>A group or an array of groups to add</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_add_non_persistent_groups"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_add_non_persistent_groups" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_add_non_persistent_groups .collapse"> <h2>Adds a group or set of groups to the list of non-persistent groups.</h2> <pre>wp_cache_add_non_persistent_groups(string | array $groups) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$groups</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>A group or an array of groups to add</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_close"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_close" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_close .collapse"> <h2>Closes the cache.</h2> <pre>wp_cache_close() : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function has ceased to do anything since WordPress 2.5. The functionality was removed along with the rest of the persistent cache. This does not mean that plugins can't implement this function when they need to make sure that the cache is cleaned up after WordPress no longer needs it.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>Always returns True</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_decr"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_decr" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_decr .collapse"> <h2>Decrement numeric cache item's value</h2> <pre>wp_cache_decr(int | string $key, int $offset, string $group) : false | int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_object_cache</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Object_Cache::decr()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$key</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><p>The cache key to increment</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$offset</h4> <code>int</code><p>The amount by which to decrement the item's value. Default is 1.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$group</h4> <code>string</code><p>The group the key is in.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>false</code><code>int</code>False on failure, the item's new value on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_delete"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_delete" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_delete .collapse"> <h2>Removes the cache contents matching key and group.</h2> <pre>wp_cache_delete(int | string $key, string $group) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_object_cache</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Object_Cache::delete()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$key</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><p>What the contents in the cache are called</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$group</h4> <code>string</code><p>Where the cache contents are grouped</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>True on successful removal, false on failure</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_flush"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_flush" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_flush .collapse"> <h2>Removes all cache items.</h2> <pre>wp_cache_flush() : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_object_cache</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Object_Cache::flush()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>Always returns true</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_get"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_get" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_get .collapse"> <h2>Retrieves the cache contents from the cache by key and group.</h2> <pre>wp_cache_get(int | string $key, string $group, bool $force, \bool $found) : bool | mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_object_cache</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Object_Cache::get()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$key</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><p>What the contents in the cache are called</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$group</h4> <code>string</code><p>Where the cache contents are grouped</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$force</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to force an update of the local cache from the persistent cache (default is false)</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$found</h4> <code>\bool</code><p>Whether key was found in the cache. Disambiguates a return of false, a storable value.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>mixed</code>False on failure to retrieve contents or the cache contents on success</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_incr"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_cache_incr" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_cache_incr .collapse"> <h2>Increment numeric cache item's value</h2> <pre>wp_cache_incr(int | string $key, int $offset, string $group) : false | int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wp_object_cache</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Object_Cache::incr()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$key</h4> <code>int</code><code>string</code><p>The cache key to increment</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$offset</h4> <code>int</code><p>The amount by which to increment the item's value. Default is 1.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$group</h4> <code>string</code><p>The group the key is in.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>false</code><code>int</code>False on failure, the item's new value on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_cache_init"></a><div class="element clickable function Key is the file extension with value as the mime type.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Values for the extension, MIME, and either a corrected filename or false if original $filename is valid</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_check_for_changed_slugs"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_check_for_changed_slugs" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_check_for_changed_slugs .collapse"> <h2>Checked for changed slugs for published post objects and save the old slug.</h2> <pre>wp_check_for_changed_slugs(int $post_id, object $post, object $post_before) : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The function is used when a post object of any type is updated, by comparing the current and previous post objects.</p> <p>If the slug was changed and not already part of the old slugs then it will be added to the post meta field ('_wp_old_slug') for storing old slugs for that post.</p> <p>The most logically usage of this function is redirecting changed post objects, so that those that linked to an changed post will be redirected to the new post.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_before</h4> <code>object</code><p>The Previous Post Object</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>int</code>Same as $post_id</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_check_invalid_utf8"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_check_invalid_utf8" data-toggle="collapse" The $hash parameter is the encrypted password and the function compares the plain text password when encrypted similarly against the already encrypted password to see if they match.</p> <p>For integration with other applications, this function can be overwritten to instead use the other package password checking algorithm.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5</td> </tr> <tr> <th>global</th> <td>object $wp_hasher PHPass object used for checking the password against the $hash + $password</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\PasswordHash::CheckPassword</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$password</h4> <code>string</code><p>Plaintext user's password</p> </div> <div <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>False, if the $password does not match the hashed password</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_check_post_hierarchy_for_loops"></a><div Won't display the token for other users.</p> <p>The function was backported to 2.0.10 and was added to versions 2.1.3 and above. Does not exist in versions prior to 2.0.10 in the 2.0 branch and in the 2.1 branch, prior to 2.1.3. Technically added in 2.2.0.</p> <p>Backported to 2.0.10.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.3</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$post</td> </tr> It does not give you the number of attachments that are children of a post. You can get that by counting the number of children that post has.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$mime_type</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Those properties contain the amount of comments that match the status. The 'total_comments' property contains the integer of total comments.</p> <p>The comment stats are cached and then retrieved, if they already exist in the cache.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>Comment stats.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_count_posts"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_count_posts" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_count_posts .collapse"> <h2>Count number of posts of a post type and is user has permissions to view.</h2> <pre>wp_count_posts(string $type, string $perm) : object</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function provides an efficient method of finding the amount of post's type a blog has. Another method is to count the amount of items in get_posts(), but that method has a lot of overhead with doing so. Therefore, when developing for 2.5+, use this function instead.</p> <p>The $perm parameter checks for 'readable' value and if the user can read private posts, it will display that for the user that is signed in.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/wp_count_posts">http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/wp_count_posts</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$type</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. 'readable' or empty.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code>Number of posts for each status</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_count_terms"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_count_terms" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_count_terms .collapse"> <h2>Count how many terms are in Taxonomy.</h2> <pre>wp_count_terms(string $taxonomy, array | string $args) : int</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Default $args is 'hide_empty' which can be 'hide_empty=true' or array('hide_empty' => true).</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\get_terms()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_parse_args()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy name</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Overwrite defaults. int $dst_w, int $dst_h, int $src_abs, string $dst_file) : string | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a> | false</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement If the source crop points are absolute.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$dst_file</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. The destination file to write to.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code><code>false</code>New filepath on success, WP_Error or false on failure.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_customize_support_script"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_customize_support_script" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_customize_support_script .collapse"> <h2>Prints a script to check whether or not the customizer is supported, and apply either the no-customize-support or customize-support class to the body.</h2> <pre>wp_customize_support_script() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function MUST be called inside the body tag.</p> <p>Ideally, call this function immediately after the body tag is opened. This prevents a flash of unstyled content.</p> <p>It is also recommended that you add the "no-customize-support" class to the body tag by default.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.4.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_customize_url"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_customize_url" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_customize_url .collapse"> <h2>Returns a URL to load the theme customizer.</h2> <pre>wp_customize_url(string $stylesheet) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.4.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$stylesheet</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. Theme to customize. Defaults to current theme. The theme's stylesheet will be urlencoded if necessary.</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_dashboard"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_dashboard" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_dashboard .collapse"> <h2>Displays the dashboard.</h2> <pre>wp_dashboard() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_dashboard_browser_nag"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_dashboard_browser_nag" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_dashboard_browser_nag .collapse"> <h2>wp_dashboard_browser_nag() </h2> <pre>wp_dashboard_browser_nag() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_dashboard_cached_rss_widget"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_dashboard_cached_rss_widget" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_dashboard_cached_rss_widget .collapse"> <h2>Checks to see if all of the feed url in $check_urls are cached.</h2> <pre>wp_dashboard_cached_rss_widget(string $widget_id, callback $callback, array $check_urls) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If $check_urls is empty, look for the rss feed url found in the dashboard widget options of $widget_id. If cached, call $callback, a function that echoes out output for this widget. If not cache, echo a "Loading..." stub which is later replaced by AJAX call (see top of /wp-admin/index.php)</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$widget_id</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$callback</h4> <code>callback</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$check_urls</h4> <code>array</code><p>RSS feeds</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>False on failure. True on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_dashboard_empty"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_dashboard_empty" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_dashboard_empty .collapse"> <h2>Empty function usable by plugins to output empty dashboard widget (to be populated later by JS).</h2> <pre>wp_dashboard_empty() </pre> <div callback.</h2> <pre>wp_dashboard_trigger_widget_control(int $widget_control_id) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div
