data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_debug_backtrace_summary .collapse"> <h2>Return a comma separated string of functions that have been called to get to the current point in code.</h2> <pre>wp_debug_backtrace_summary(string $ignore_class, int $skip_frames, bool $pretty) : string | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/19589">http://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/19589</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.4</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$ignore_class</h4> <code>string</code><p>A class to ignore all function calls within - useful when you want to just give info about the callee</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$skip_frames</h4> <code>int</code><p>A number of stack frames to skip - useful for unwinding back to the source of the issue</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$pretty</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether or not you want a comma separated string or raw array returned</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code>array</code>Either a string containing a reversed comma separated trace or an array of individual calls.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_default_editor"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_default_editor" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_default_editor .collapse"> <h2>Find out which editor should be displayed by default.</h2> <pre>wp_default_editor() : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Works out which of the two editors to display as the current editor for a user.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Either 'tinymce', or 'html', or 'test'</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_default_scripts"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_default_scripts" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_default_scripts .collapse"> <h2>Register all WordPress scripts.</h2> <pre>wp_default_scripts(object $scripts) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Localizes some of them. args order: $scripts->add( 'handle', 'url', 'dependencies', 'query-string', 1 ); when last arg === 1 queues the script for the footer</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$scripts</h4> <code>object</code><p>WP_Scripts object.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_default_styles"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_default_styles" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_default_styles .collapse"> <h2>Assign default styles to $styles object.</h2> <pre>wp_default_styles(object $styles) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Nothing is returned, because the $styles parameter is passed by reference. Meaning that whatever object is passed will be updated without having to reassign the variable that was passed back to the same value. This saves memory.</p> <p>Adding default styles is not the only task, it also assigns the base_url property, the default version, and text direction for the object.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$styles</h4> <code>object</code> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_defer_comment_counting"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_defer_comment_counting" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_defer_comment_counting .collapse"> <h2>Whether to defer comment counting.</h2> <pre>wp_defer_comment_counting(bool $defer) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>When setting $defer to true, all post comment counts will not be updated until $defer is set to false. When $defer is set to false, then all previously deferred updated post comment counts will then be automatically updated without having to call wp_update_comment_count() after.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>staticvar</th> <td>bool $_defer</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$defer</h4> <code>bool</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_defer_term_counting"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_defer_term_counting" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_defer_term_counting .collapse"> <h2>Enable or disable term counting.</h2> <pre>wp_defer_term_counting(bool $defer) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$defer</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional. Enable if true, disable if false.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>Whether term counting is enabled or disabled.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_attachment"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_delete_attachment" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_delete_attachment .collapse"> <h2>Trashes or deletes an attachment.</h2> <pre>wp_delete_attachment(int $post_id, bool $force_delete) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>When an attachment is permanently deleted, the file will also be removed. Deletion removes all post meta fields, taxonomy, comments, etc. associated with the attachment (except the main post).</p> <p>The attachment is moved to the trash instead of permanently deleted unless trash for media is disabled, item is already in the trash, or $force_delete is true.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Attachment ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$force_delete</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to bypass trash and force deletion. Defaults to false.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>False on failure. Post data on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_auto_drafts"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_delete_auto_drafts" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_delete_auto_drafts .collapse"> <h2>Deletes auto-drafts for new posts that are > 7 days old</h2> <pre>wp_delete_auto_drafts() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.4.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_category"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_delete_category" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_delete_category .collapse"> <h2>Deletes one existing category.</h2> <pre>wp_delete_category(int $cat_ID) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_delete_term()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$cat_ID</h4> <code>int</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Returns true if completes delete action; false if term doesn't exist; Zero on attempted deletion of default Category; WP_Error object is also a possibility.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_comment"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_delete_comment" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_delete_comment .collapse"> <h2>Trashes or deletes a comment.</h2> <pre>wp_delete_comment(int $comment_id, bool $force_delete) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The comment is moved to trash instead of permanently deleted unless trash is disabled, item is already in the trash, or $force_delete is true.</p> <p>The post comment count will be updated if the comment was approved and has a post ID available.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_transition_comment_status()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$comment_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Comment ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$force_delete</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to bypass trash and force deletion. Default is false.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>False if delete comment query failure, true on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_delete_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_delete_link .collapse"> <h2>Delete link specified from database</h2> <pre>wp_delete_link(int $link_id) : bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$link_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>ID of the link to delete</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code>True</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_nav_menu"></a><div class="element clickable function class="long_description"><p>Will remove all relationships between the object and any terms in a particular taxonomy or taxonomies. Does not remove the term or taxonomy itself.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$object_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>The term Object Id that refers to the term</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomies</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>List of Taxonomy Names or single Taxonomy name.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_post"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_delete_post" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_delete_post .collapse"> <h2>Trashes or deletes a post or page.</h2> <pre>wp_delete_post(int $postid, bool $force_delete) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>When the post and page is permanently deleted, everything that is tied to it is deleted also. This includes comments, post meta fields, and terms associated with the post.</p> <p>The post or page is moved to trash instead of permanently deleted unless trash is disabled, item is already in the trash, or $force_delete is true.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_delete_attachment()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_trash_post()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$postid</h4> <code>int</code><p>Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$force_delete</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to bypass trash and force deletion. Defaults to false.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>False on failure</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_post_revision"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_delete_post_revision" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_delete_post_revision .collapse"> <h2>Deletes a revision.</h2> <pre>wp_delete_post_revision(int | object $revision_id) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Deletes the row from the posts table corresponding to the specified revision.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Post.Revisions.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Post_Revisions</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.6.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_get_post_revision()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_delete_post()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$revision_id</h4> <code>int</code><code>object</code><p>Revision ID or revision object.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>Null or WP_Error if error, deleted post if success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_delete_term"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_delete_term" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_delete_term .collapse"> <h2>Removes a term from the database.</h2> <pre>wp_delete_term(int $term, string $taxonomy, array | string $args) : bool | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If the term is a parent of other terms, then the children will be updated to that term's parent.</p> <p>The $args 'default' will only override the terms found, if there is only one term found. Any other and the found terms are used.</p> <p>The $args 'force_default' will force the term supplied as default to be assigned even if the object was not going to be termless</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\do_action()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$term</h4> <code>int</code><p>Term ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code><p>Taxonomy Name</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Optional. data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_die .collapse"> <h2>Kill WordPress execution and display HTML message with error message.</h2> <pre>wp_die(string $message, string $title, string | array $args) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function complements the die() PHP function. The difference is that HTML will be displayed to the user. It is recommended to use this function only, when the execution should not continue any further. It is not recommended to call this function very often and try to handle as many errors as possible silently.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0.4</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$message</h4> <code>string</code><p>Error message.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$title</h4> <code>string</code><p>Error title.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional arguments to control behavior.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_doc_link_parse"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_doc_link_parse" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_doc_link_parse .collapse"> <h2>wp_doc_link_parse() </h2> <pre>wp_doc_link_parse($content) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$content</h4></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_dropdown_categories"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_dropdown_categories" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_dropdown_categories .collapse"> <h2>Display or retrieve the HTML dropdown list of categories.</h2> <pre>wp_dropdown_categories(string | array $args) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The list of arguments is below: 'show_option_all' (string) - Text to display for showing all categories. 'show_option_none' (string) - Text to display for showing no categories. 'orderby' (string) default is 'ID' - What column to use for ordering the categories. 'order' (string) default is 'ASC' - What direction to order categories. 'show_count' (bool|int) default is 0 - Whether to show how many posts are in the category. 'hide_empty' (bool|int) default is 1 - Whether to hide categories that don't have any posts attached to them. 'child_of' (int) default is 0 - See <a href="get_categories()">get_categories()</a>. 'exclude' (string) - See <a href="get_categories()">get_categories()</a>. 'echo' (bool|int) default is 1 - Whether to display or retrieve content. 'depth' (int) - The max depth. 'tab_index' (int) - Tab index for select element. 'name' (string) - The name attribute value for select element. 'id' (string) - The ID attribute value for select element. Defaults to name if omitted. 'class' (string) - The class attribute value for select element. 'selected' (int) - Which category ID is selected. 'taxonomy' (string) - The name of the taxonomy to retrieve. Defaults to category.</p> <p>The 'hierarchical' argument, which is disabled by default, will override the depth argument, unless it is true. When the argument is false, it will display all of the categories. When it is enabled it will use the value in the 'depth' argument.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Override default arguments.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>HTML content only if 'echo' argument is 0.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_dropdown_cats"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_dropdown_cats" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_dropdown_cats .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>wp_dropdown_cats(\unknown_type $currentcat, \unknown_type $currentparent, \unknown_type $parent, \unknown_type $level, \unknown_type $categories) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>deprecated</th> <td>Use wp_dropdown_categories()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\wp_dropdown_categories()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$currentcat</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$currentparent</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$parent</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$level</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <div class="subelement id="function_wp_dropdown_pages"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_dropdown_pages" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_dropdown_pages .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve or display list of pages as a dropdown (select list).</h2> <pre>wp_dropdown_pages(array | string $args) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div The 'include' and 'exclude' arguments do not need to be used; all users will be displayed in that case. Only one can be used, either 'include' or 'exclude', but not both.</p> <p>The available arguments are as follows:</p> <ol> <li>show_option_all - Text to show all and whether HTML option exists.</li> <li>show_option_none - Text for show none and whether HTML option exists.</li> <li>hide_if_only_one_author - Don't create the dropdown if there is only one user.</li> <li>orderby - SQL order by clause for what order the users appear. Default is 'display_name'.</li> <li>order - Default is 'ASC'. Can also be 'DESC'.</li> <li>include - User IDs to include.</li> <li>exclude - User IDs to exclude.</li> <li>multi - Default is 'false'. Whether to skip the ID attribute on the 'select' element. A 'true' value is overridden when id argument is set.</li> <li>show - Default is 'display_name'. User table column to display. If the selected item is empty then the user_login will be displayed in parentheses</li> <li>echo - Default is '1'. Whether to display or retrieve content.</li> <li>selected - Which User ID is selected.</li> <li>include_selected - Always include the selected user ID in the dropdown. Default is false.</li> <li>name - Default is 'user'. Name attribute of select element.</li> <li>id - Default is the value of the 'name' parameter. ID attribute of select element.</li> <li>class - Class attribute of select element.</li> <li>blog_id - ID of blog (Multisite only). Defaults to ID of current blog.</li> <li>who - Which users to query. Currently only 'authors' is supported. Default is all users.</li> </ol></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Override defaults.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code>null</code>Null on display. String of HTML content on retrieve.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_edit_attachments_query"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_edit_attachments_query" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_edit_attachments_query .collapse"> <h2>{@internal Missing Short Description}}</h2> <pre>wp_edit_attachments_query(\unknown_type $q) : \unknown</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$q</h4> <code>\unknown_type</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>\unknown</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_edit_posts_query"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_edit_posts_query" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_edit_posts_query .collapse"> <h2>Run the wp query to fetch the posts for listing on the edit posts page</h2> <pre>wp_edit_posts_query(array | bool $q) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>array</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_editor"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_editor" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_editor .collapse"> <h2>Renders an editor.</h2> <pre>wp_editor(string $content, string $editor_id, array $settings) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Using this function is the proper way to output all needed components for both TinyMCE and Quicktags. _WP_Editors should not be used directly. See http://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/17144.</p> <p>NOTE: Once initialized the TinyMCE editor cannot be safely moved in the DOM. For that reason running wp_editor() inside of a metabox is not a good idea unless only Quicktags is used. On the post edit screen several actions can be used to include additional editors containing TinyMCE: 'edit_page_form', 'edit_form_advanced' and 'dbx_post_sidebar'. See http://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/19173 for more information.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\wp-includes/class-wp-editor.php</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.3.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$content</h4> <code>string</code><p>Initial content for the editor.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$editor_id</h4> <code>string</code><p>HTML ID attribute value for the textarea and TinyMCE. Can only be /[a-z]+/.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$settings</h4> <code>array</code><p>See _WP_Editors::editor().</p> </div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_embed_defaults"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_embed_defaults" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_embed_defaults .collapse"> <h2>Create default array of embed parameters.</h2> <pre>wp_embed_defaults() : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.9.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Default embed parameters.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_embed_handler_googlevideo"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_embed_handler_googlevideo" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_embed_handler_googlevideo .collapse"> <h2>The Google Video embed handler callback.</h2> <pre>wp_embed_handler_googlevideo(array $matches, array $attr, string $url, array $rawattr) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Google Video does not support oEmbed.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Embed::register_handler()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Embed::shortcode()</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$matches</h4> <code>array</code><p>The regex matches from the provided regex when calling {@link wp_embed_register_handler()}.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attr</h4> <code>array</code><p>Embed attributes.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$url</h4> <code>string</code><p>The original URL that was matched by the regex.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$rawattr</h4> <code>array</code><p>The original unmodified attributes.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The embed HTML.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_embed_register_handler"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_embed_register_handler" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_embed_register_handler .collapse"> <h2>Register an embed handler.</h2> <pre>wp_embed_register_handler($id, $regex, $callback, $priority) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function should probably only be used for sites that do not support class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Allows plugins to queue scripts for the front end using wp_enqueue_script(). Runs first in wp_head() where all is_home(), is_page(), etc. functions are available.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_enqueue_style"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_enqueue_style" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_enqueue_style .collapse"> <h2>Enqueue a CSS style file.</h2> <pre>wp_enqueue_style(string $handle, string | bool $src, array $deps, string | bool $ver, string $media) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Registers the style if src provided (does NOT overwrite) and enqueues.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>r79</td> </tr> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\WP_Styles::add(),</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>global</th> <td>object $wp_styles The WP_Styles object for printing styles.</td> </tr> <tr> <th>link</th> <td><a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/media.html#media-types">List of CSS media types.</a></td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$handle</h4> <code>string</code><p>Name of the stylesheet.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$src</h4> <code>string</code><code>bool</code><p>Path to the stylesheet from the root directory of WordPress. Example: '/css/mystyle.css'.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$deps</h4> <code>array</code><p>Array of handles (names) of any stylesheet that this stylesheet depends on. (Stylesheets that must be loaded before this stylesheet.) Pass an empty array if there are no dependencies.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$ver</h4> <code>string</code><code>bool</code><p>String specifying the stylesheet version number, if it has one. This parameter is used to ensure that the correct version is sent to the client regardless of caching, and so should be included if a version number is available and makes sense for the stylesheet.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$media</h4> <code>string</code><p>The media for which this stylesheet has been defined.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a <h2>Filters a list of objects, based on a set of key => value arguments.</h2> <pre>wp_filter_object_list(array $list, array $args, string $operator, bool | string $field) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$list</h4> <code>array</code><p>An array of objects to filter</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> perform. 'or' means only one element from the array needs to match; 'and' means all elements must match. id="function_wp_find_hierarchy_loop"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_find_hierarchy_loop" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_find_hierarchy_loop .collapse"> <h2>Finds hierarchy loops using a callback function that maps object IDs to parent IDs.</h2> <pre>wp_find_hierarchy_loop(callback $callback, int $start, int $start_parent, array $callback_args) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>access</th> <td>private</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$callback</h4> <code>callback</code><p>function that accepts ( ID, $callback_args ) and outputs parent_ID</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$start</h4> <code>int</code><p>The ID to start the loop check at</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$start_parent</h4> <code>int</code><p>the parent_ID of $start to use instead of calling $callback( $start ). Use null to always use $callback</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$callback_args</h4> <code>array</code><p>optional additional arguments to send to $callback</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>IDs of all members of loop</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_find_hierarchy_loop_tortoise_hare"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_find_hierarchy_loop_tortoise_hare" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_find_hierarchy_loop_tortoise_hare .collapse"> <h2>Uses the "The Tortoise and the Hare" algorithm to detect loops.</h2> <pre>wp_find_hierarchy_loop_tortoise_hare(callback $callback, int $start, array $override, array $callback_args, bool $_return_loop) : mixed</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>For every step of the algorithm, the hare takes two steps and the tortoise one. If the hare ever laps the tortoise, there must be a loop.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>access</th> <td>private</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$callback</h4> <code>callback</code><p>function that accepts ( ID, callback_arg, ... ) and outputs parent_ID</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$start</h4> <code>int</code><p>The ID to start the loop check at</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$override</h4> <code>array</code><p>an array of ( ID => parent_ID, ... ) to use instead of $callback</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$callback_args</h4> <code>array</code><p>optional additional arguments to send to $callback</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$_return_loop</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Return loop members or just detect presence of loop? Only set to true if you already know the given $start is part of a loop (otherwise the returned array might include branches)</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>mixed</code>scalar ID of some arbitrary member of the loop, or array of IDs of all members of loop if $_return_loop</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_footer"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_footer" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_footer .collapse"> <h2>Fire the wp_footer action</h2> <pre>wp_footer() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div data-target=".function_wp_generate_auth_cookie .collapse"> <h2>Generate authentication cookie contents.</h2> <pre>wp_generate_auth_cookie(int $user_id, int $expiration, string $scheme) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$user_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>User ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$expiration</h4> <code>int</code><p>Cookie expiration in seconds</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$scheme</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional. The cookie scheme to use: auth, secure_auth, or logged_in</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Authentication cookie contents</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_generate_password"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_generate_password" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_generate_password .collapse"> <h2>Generates a random password drawn from the defined set of characters.</h2> <pre>wp_generate_password(int $length, bool $special_chars, bool $extra_special_chars) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$length</h4> <code>int</code><p>The length of password to generate</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$special_chars</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to include standard special characters. Default true.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$extra_special_chars</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to include other special characters. Used when generating secret keys and salts. Default false.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>The random password</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_generate_tag_cloud"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_generate_tag_cloud" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_generate_tag_cloud .collapse"> <h2>Generates a tag cloud (heatmap) from provided data.</h2> <pre>wp_generate_tag_cloud(array $tags, string | array $args) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The text size is set by the 'smallest' and 'largest' arguments, which will use the 'unit' argument value for the CSS text size unit. The 'format' argument can be 'flat' (default), 'list', or 'array'. The flat value for the 'format' argument will separate tags with spaces. The list value for the 'format' argument will format the tags in a UL HTML list. The array value for the 'format' argument will return in PHP array type format.</p> <p>The 'tag_cloud_sort' filter allows you to override the sorting. Passed to the filter: $tags array and $args array, has to return the $tags array after sorting it.</p> <p>The 'orderby' argument will accept 'name' or 'count' and defaults to 'name'. The 'order' is the direction to sort, defaults to 'ASC' and can be 'DESC' or 'RAND'.</p> <p>The 'number' argument is how many tags to return. By default, the limit will be to return the entire tag cloud list.</p> <p>The 'topic_count_text_callback' argument is a function, which given the count of the posts with that tag returns a text for the tooltip of the tag link.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>todo</th> <td>Complete functionality.</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$tags</h4> <code>array</code><p>List of tags.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional, override default arguments.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>string</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_generator"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_generator" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_generator .collapse"> <h2>Display the XHTML generator that is generated on the wp_head hook.</h2> <pre>wp_generator() </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_active_network_plugins"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_active_network_plugins" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_active_network_plugins .collapse"> <h2>Returns array of network plugin files to be included in global scope.</h2> <pre>wp_get_active_network_plugins() : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The default directory is wp-content/plugins. To change the default directory manually, define</p> <pre><code>WP_PLUGIN_DIR</code></pre> <p>and</p> <pre><code>WP_PLUGIN_URL</code></pre> <p>in wp-config.php.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>access</th> <td>private</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Files to include</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_archives"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_archives" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_archives .collapse"> <h2>Display archive links based on type and format.</h2> <pre>wp_get_archives(string | array $args) </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The 'type' argument offers a few choices and by default will display monthly archive links. The other options for values are 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'yearly', 'postbypost' or 'alpha'. Both 'postbypost' and 'alpha' display the same archive link list, the difference between the two is that 'alpha' will order by post title and 'postbypost' will order by post date.</p> <p>The date archives will logically display dates with links to the archive post page. The 'postbypost' and 'alpha' values for 'type' argument will display the post titles.</p> <p>The 'limit' argument will only display a limited amount of links, specified by the 'limit' integer value. By default, there is no limit. The 'show_post_count' argument will show how many posts are within the archive. By default, the 'show_post_count' argument is set to false.</p> <p>For the 'format', 'before', and 'after' arguments, see {@link get_archives_link()}. The values of these arguments have to do with that function.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.2.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>Optional. Override defaults.</p></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_associated_nav_menu_items"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_associated_nav_menu_items" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_associated_nav_menu_items .collapse"> <h2>Get the menu items associated with a particular object.</h2> <pre>wp_get_associated_nav_menu_items(int $object_id, string $object_type) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$object_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>The ID of the original object.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$object_type</h4> <code>string</code><p>The type of object, such as "taxonomy" or "post_type."</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>The array of menu item IDs; empty array if none;</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_attachment_image"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_attachment_image" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_attachment_image .collapse"> <h2>Get an HTML img element representing an image attachment</h2> <pre>wp_get_attachment_image(int $attachment_id, string $size, bool $icon, $attr) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>While $size will accept an array, it is better to register a size with add_image_size() so that a cropped version is generated. It's much more efficient than having to find the closest-sized image and then having the browser scale down the image.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>see</th> <td><a href="">\global\add_image_size()</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_get_attachment_image_src()</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attachment_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Image attachment ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$size</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is 'thumbnail'.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$icon</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. Whether it is an icon.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"><h4>$attr</h4></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>HTML img element or empty string on failure.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_attachment_image_src"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_attachment_image_src" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_attachment_image_src .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve an image to represent an attachment.</h2> <pre>wp_get_attachment_image_src(int $attachment_id, string $size, bool $icon) : bool | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>A mime icon for files, thumbnail or intermediate size for images.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$attachment_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Image attachment ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$size</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is 'thumbnail'.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$icon</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. Whether it is an icon.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>array</code>Returns an array (url, width, height), or false, if no image is available.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_attachment_link"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_attachment_link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_attachment_link .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve an attachment page link using an image or icon, if possible.</h2> <pre>wp_get_attachment_link(int $id, string $size, bool $permalink, bool $icon, string $text) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.5.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Optional. Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$size</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is 'thumbnail'. Size of image, either array or string.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$permalink</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. Whether to add permalink to image.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$icon</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. Whether to include icon.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$text</h4> <code>string</code><p>Optional, default is false. If string, then will be link text.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>HTML content.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_attachment_metadata"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_attachment_metadata" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_attachment_metadata .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve attachment meta field for attachment ID.</h2> <pre>wp_get_attachment_metadata(int $post_id, bool $unfiltered) : string | bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$post_id</h4> <code>int</code><p>Attachment ID</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$unfiltered</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Optional, default is false. File path to write request to.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$red</h4> <code>int</code><p>(private) The number of Redirects followed, Upon 5 being hit, returns false.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>bool</code><code>string</code>False on failure and string of headers if HEAD request.</div> </div></div> </div> <a function_wp_get_nav_menu_to_edit" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_nav_menu_to_edit .collapse"> <h2>Returns the menu formatted to edit.</h2> <pre>wp_get_nav_menu_to_edit(string $menu_id) : string | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$menu_id</h4> <code>string</code><p>The ID of the menu to format.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code>$output The menu formatted to edit or error object on failure.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_nav_menus"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_nav_menus" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_nav_menus .collapse"> <h2>Returns all navigation menu objects.</h2> <pre>wp_get_nav_menus(array $args) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> objects</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_nocache_headers"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_nocache_headers" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_nocache_headers .collapse"> <h2>Gets the header information to prevent caching.</h2> <pre>wp_get_nocache_headers() : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The several different headers cover the different ways cache prevention is handled by different browsers</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.8.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters()</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>The associative array of header names and field values.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_object_terms"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_object_terms" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_object_terms .collapse"> <h2>Retrieves the terms associated with the given object(s), in the supplied taxonomies.</h2> <pre>wp_get_object_terms(int | array $object_ids, string | array $taxonomies, array | string $args) : array | <a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The following information has to do the $args parameter and for what can be contained in the string or array of that parameter, if it exists.</p> <p>The first argument is called, 'orderby' and has the default value of 'name'. The other value that is supported is 'count'.</p> <p>The second argument is called, 'order' and has the default value of 'ASC'. The only other value that will be acceptable is 'DESC'.</p> <p>The final argument supported is called, 'fields' and has the default value of 'all'. There are multiple other options that can be used instead. Supported values are as follows: 'all', 'ids', 'names', and finally 'all_with_object_id'.</p> <p>The fields argument also decides what will be returned. If 'all' or 'all_with_object_id' is chosen or the default kept intact, then all matching terms objects will be returned. If either 'ids' or 'names' is used, then an array of all matching term ids or term names will be returned respectively.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.Taxonomy.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>Taxonomy</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.3.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\$wpdb</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$object_ids</h4> <code>int</code><code>array</code><p>The ID(s) of the object(s) to retrieve.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomies</h4> <code>string</code><code>array</code><p>The taxonomies to retrieve terms from.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><code>string</code><p>Change what is returned</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code><code><a href="../classes/WP_Error.html">\WP_Error</a></code>The requested term data or empty array if no terms found. WP_Error if any of the $taxonomies don't exist.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_original_referer"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_original_referer" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_original_referer .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve original referer that was posted, if it exists.</h2> <pre>wp_get_original_referer() : string | bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a Referer URL on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_schedule"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_schedule" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_schedule .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve Cron schedule for hook with arguments.</h2> <pre>wp_get_schedule(string $hook, array $args) : string | bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$hook</h4> <code>string</code><p>Action hook to execute when cron is run.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. Arguments to pass to the hook's callback function.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code><code>bool</code>False, if no schedule. Schedule on success.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_schedules"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_schedules" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_schedules .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve supported and filtered Cron recurrences.</h2> <pre>wp_get_schedules() : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>The supported recurrences are 'hourly' and 'daily'. A plugin may add more by hooking into the 'cron_schedules' filter. The filter accepts an array of arrays. The outer array has a key that is the name of the schedule or for example 'weekly'. The value is an array with two keys, one is 'interval' and the other is 'display'.</p> <p>The 'interval' is a number in seconds of when the cron job should run. So for 'hourly', the time is 3600 or 60<em>60. For weekly, the value would be 60</em>60<em>24</em>7 or 604800. The value of 'interval' would then be 604800.</p> <p>The 'display' is the description. For the 'weekly' key, the 'display' would be</p> <pre><code>__('Once Weekly')</code></pre> <p>.</p> <p>For your plugin, you will be passed an array. you can easily add your schedule by doing the following.</p> <pre><code>// filter parameter variable name is 'array' $array['weekly'] = array( 'interval' => 604800, 'display' => __('Once Weekly') ); </code></pre></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"><code>array</code></div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_shortlink"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_shortlink" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_shortlink .collapse"> <h2>Return a shortlink for a post, page, attachment, or blog.</h2> <pre>wp_get_shortlink(int $id, string $context, bool $allow_slugs) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>This function exists to provide a shortlink tag that all themes and plugins can target. A plugin must hook in to provide the actual shortlinks. Default shortlink support is limited to providing ?p= style links for posts. Plugins can short-circuit this function via the pre_get_shortlink filter or filter the output via the get_shortlink filter.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.0.0.</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$id</h4> <code>int</code><p>A post or blog id. Default is 0, which means the current post or blog.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$context</h4> <code>string</code><p>Whether the id is a 'blog' id, 'post' id, or 'media' id. If 'post', the post_type of the post is consulted. If 'query', the current query is consulted to determine the id and context. Default is 'post'.</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$allow_slugs</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Whether to allow post slugs in the shortlink. It is up to the plugin how and whether to honor this.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>A shortlink or an empty string if no shortlink exists for the requested resource or if shortlinks are not enabled.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_sidebars_widgets"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_sidebars_widgets" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_sidebars_widgets .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve full list of sidebars and their widgets.</h2> <pre>wp_get_sidebars_widgets(bool $deprecated) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Will upgrade sidebar widget list, if needed. Will also save updated list, if needed.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>access</th> <td>private</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$deprecated</h4> <code>bool</code><p>Not used (deprecated).</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>array</code>Upgraded list of widgets to version 3 array format when called from the admin.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_single_post"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_single_post" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_single_post .collapse"> <h2>Retrieve a single post, based on post ID.</h2> <pre>wp_get_single_post(int $postid, string $mode) : object | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Has categories in 'post_category' property or key. Has tags in 'tags_input' property or key.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>1.0.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$postid</h4> <code>int</code><p>Post ID.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$mode</h4> <code>string</code><p>How to return result, either OBJECT, ARRAY_N, or ARRAY_A.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>object</code><code>array</code>Post object or array holding post contents and information</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_term_taxonomy_parent_id"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_term_taxonomy_parent_id" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_term_taxonomy_parent_id .collapse"> <h2>Returns the term's parent's term_ID</h2> <pre>wp_get_term_taxonomy_parent_id(int $term_id, string $taxonomy) : int | bool</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.1.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$term_id</h4> <code>int</code> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$taxonomy</h4> <code>string</code> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>int</code><code>bool</code>false on error</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_theme"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_theme" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_theme .collapse"> <h2>Gets a WP_Theme object for a theme.</h2> <pre>wp_get_theme(string $stylesheet, string $theme_root) : <a href="../classes/WP_Theme.html">\WP_Theme</a></pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.4.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$stylesheet</h4> <code>string</code><p>Directory name for the theme. Optional. Defaults to current theme.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$theme_root</h4> <code>string</code><p>Absolute path of the theme root to look in. Optional. If not specified, get_raw_theme_root() is used to calculate the theme root for the $stylesheet provided (or current theme).</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code><a href="../classes/WP_Theme.html">\WP_Theme</a></code>Theme object. Be sure to check the object's exists() method if you need to confirm the theme's existence.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_themes"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_themes" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_themes .collapse"> <h2>Returns an array of WP_Theme objects based on the arguments.</h2> <pre>wp_get_themes(array $args) : Array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Despite advances over get_themes(), this function is quite expensive, and grows linearly with additional themes. Stick to wp_get_theme() if possible.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>3.4.0</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$args</h4> <code>array</code><p>The search arguments. Optional. - errors mixed True to return themes with errors, false to return themes without errors, null to return all themes. Defaults to false. - allowed mixed (Multisite) True to return only allowed themes for a site. False to return only disallowed themes for a site. 'site' to return only site-allowed themes. 'network' to return only network-allowed themes. Null to return all themes. Defaults to null. - blog_id int (Multisite) The blog ID used to calculate which themes are allowed. Defaults to 0, synonymous for the current blog.</p> </div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>Array</code>of WP_Theme objects.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_get_update_data"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_get_update_data" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_get_update_data .collapse"> array similar to that of a PHP $_FILES POST array</p> </div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$overrides</h4> <code>array</code><p>Optional. On failure, returns $overrides['upload_error_handler'](&$file, $message ) or array( 'error'=>$message ).</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_wp_handle_upload"></a><div class="element clickable function function_wp_handle_upload" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_wp_handle_upload .collapse"> <h2>Handle PHP uploads in WordPress, sanitizing file names, checking extensions for mime type, and moving the file to the appropriate directory within the uploads directory.</h2> <pre>wp_handle_upload(array $file, array $overrides, $time) : array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>2.0</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_handle_upload_error</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\apply_filters</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\is_multisite</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_check_filetype_and_ext</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\current_user_can</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_upload_dir</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\wp_unique_filename</td> </tr> <tr> <th>uses</th> <td>\global\delete_transient</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$file</h4> <code>array</code><p>Reference to a single element of $_FILES. entities safe prefix extraction.
