XMLRPC XML.</h2> <pre>xmlrpc_getpostcategory(string $content) : string | array</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If the category element is not found, then the default post category will be used. The return type then would be what $post_default_category. If the category is found, then it will always be an array.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.XMLRPC.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>XMLRPC</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> <tr> <th>global</th> <td>string $post_default_category Default XMLRPC post category.</td> </tr> </table> <code>string</code><code>array</code>List of categories or category name.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_xmlrpc_getposttitle"></a><div class="element clickable function <pre>xmlrpc_getposttitle(string $content) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If the title element is not part of the XML, then the default post title from the $post_default_title will be used instead.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a $post_default_title Default XMLRPC post title.</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$content</h4> <code>string</code><p>XMLRPC XML Request content</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Post title</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_xmlrpc_removepostdata"></a><div class="element clickable function function_xmlrpc_removepostdata" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_xmlrpc_removepostdata .collapse"> <h2>XMLRPC XML content without title and category elements.</h2> <pre>xmlrpc_removepostdata(string $content) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"></div> <table class="table table-bordered"> <tr> <th>package</th> <td><a href="../packages/WordPress.XMLRPC.html">WordPress</a></td> </tr> <tr> <th>subpackage</th> <td>XMLRPC</td> </tr> <tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr> </table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$content</h4> <code>string</code><p>XMLRPC XML Request content</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>XMLRPC XML Request content without title and category elements.</div> </div></div> </div> <a id="function_zeroise"></a><div class="element clickable function function_zeroise" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".function_zeroise .collapse"> <h2>Add leading zeros when necessary.</h2> <pre>zeroise(mixed $number, int $threshold) : string</pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>If you set the threshold to '4' and the number is '10', then you will get back '0010'. If you set the threshold to '4' and the number is '5000', then you will get back '5000'.</p> <p>Uses sprintf to append the amount of zeros based on the $threshold parameter and the size of the number. If the number is large enough, then no zeros will be appended.</p></div> <table class="table table-bordered"><tr> <th>since</th> <td>0.71</td> </tr></table> <h3>Parameters</h3> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$number</h4> <code>mixed</code><p>Number to append zeros to if not greater than threshold.</p></div> <div class="subelement argument"> <h4>$threshold</h4> <code>int</code><p>Digit places number needs to be to not have zeros added.</p></div> <h3>Returns</h3> <div class="subelement response"> <code>string</code>Adds leading zeros to number if needed.</div> </div></div> </div> class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a id="constant_WPLANG"> </a><div class="element clickable constant constant_WPLANG" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".constant_WPLANG .collapse"> <h2>WordPress Localized Language, defaults to English.</h2> <pre>WPLANG </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"><p>Change this to localize WordPress. A corresponding MO file for the chosen language must be installed to wp-content/languages. For example, install de_DE.mo to wp-content/languages and set WPLANG to 'de_DE' to enable German language support.</p></div></div></div> </div> <a id="constant_WPMU_ACCEL_REDIRECT"> </a><div class="element clickable constant constant_WPMU_ACCEL_REDIRECT" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".constant_WPMU_ACCEL_REDIRECT .collapse"> <h2>WPMU_ACCEL_REDIRECT</h2> <pre>WPMU_ACCEL_REDIRECT </pre> <div class="labels"></div> <div class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"><div class="long_description"></div></div></div> </div> <a class="row collapse"><div class="detail-description"> <div class="long_description"><p>Bump this when something changes that might affect compatibility.</p></div> <table class="table
